name: El Karnak Hotel
address: 91 26th of July Rd. Azarita, Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text: I stayed their with my friends and we enjoyed our stay . First the hotel located in a perfect location also very clean. Stuff were helpful . Our room was with amazing Sea view also with low cost and so wide . Furniture with cheerful colors and nice decoration . Really recommend it .
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text:
Cheap and dirty with shared bathroom 
 it's Ok with two days maximum 
Beds are not clean and uncomfortable 
But it's so close from the Mediterranean Sea and cheap 
I think 45 Egyptian pound per one night 
And receptionist are uncomfortable too
reviews.title: Cheap hotel

reviews.text:
No cleaning rooms 
No any hotel services 
Covers and beds are so old and bit of ugly
Shared bathrooms
Only good is location and coats low money it costs 55 Egyptian pounds  per night and other rooms costs 40 LE
reviews.title: Poor service

reviews.text: Great hotel for cheap nights with a great view. a double room for 1 person costs around 6 USD per night. Shared Bathroom. No WiFi or room service. it is all about a place to sleep at the heart of Alexandria.
reviews.title: Hotel for Cheap Nights

reviews.text: Muy buen hotel. La ubicación muy cómoda todo está cerca. Muy buena vista al mar Mediterráneo muy limpio.  Ideal para familias grandes y viajeros y muy buena iluminación. El personal muy amable y limpios
reviews.title: Buena para familia

reviews.text: Es un lugar bonito, las habitaciones cuentan con balcón con vista al Fuerte de Qaitba y al hermoso mar Mediterráneo, la habitación familiar es amplia y cómoda. El servicio de primera, el personal muy amable, buena ubicación, un lugar ideal para viajeros.
reviews.title: Excelente ubicación para viajeros

name: Tolip Alexandria Villas And Apartments
address: Moustafa Kamel, Corniche Road Roshdy, Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text: An extremely nice hotel with gorgeous views of the Mediterrean sea, and Alexandria's beaches and boardwalk.  Very nice and helpful staff.  Excellent food.  The rooms were very spacious and clean.  Very enjoyable experience.
reviews.title: Great experience and extremely nice staff

reviews.text:
قررنا نختم اجازتنا في اسكندريه واخترنا فندق صن رايز وبصراحه كان مسك الختام من حيث معامله الاستف و المطعم و نظافه الشاطيء وحمام السباحه 
جميل جدا تيم الانيميشن في روح جميله علي البحر ونشاط وحيويه 
شكرا صن رايز
reviews.title: شارع بدر الدين .سابا باشا

name: Jeddah Hotel
address: 137 El Gueish St, Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text: Have stayed there for one night. It is located infront of the sea but their are side rooms with less cost (around 130LE less than). The most I liked is the hospitality and Pullmen. They are kind and smiling. They didn't bargain for money. Rooms & bathrooms are spacious but with old furniture. Small TV but hadn't tried. Could be better if changed. No carpets in rooms. Twin beds in the Double room are very small (maybe 70 or 80 cm wide). Two small lifts. Traditional Egyptian breakfast ( beans, egg, jam, cheese, olive & tea). Location is very good. Distance to Alex library takes 8 mins driving.
reviews.title: Jeddah hotel in Alex is okay in General

reviews.text: Magnificent view to Mediterranean sea on Alexandria Cornish, very good staff and managers, good restaurant, nice building, good place , PLEASE visit it and enjoying everything in Alexandria with good weather all over the year .
reviews.title: Very good resident

reviews.text: its really dirty and old hotel and the breakfast was disgusting too...even they don't have toiletries in the room..only good thing is sea view and i don't think it is enough for a hotel..not recommended
reviews.title: disgusting

reviews.text:
It was my first visit to this hotel, it is a good hotel, good view comfortable bed, i would like to thank Mr. Moustafa the doorman as he make the hospitality as it should to be he is always smiley & offer his assistance also i would like to thank Mr. Alaa from the room service & Mr. Sayed the doorman for his warm farewell upon my check out.
The hotel have a good location & good view ( Direct sea view ) it is 3 stars hotel but it is good specially if we comparison this hotel with another 3 stars hotel.
NB : My rating according to 3 stars hotel service.

Mahmoud Yahia
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text:
It was my first hotel stay at Alexandria because i'm always rent an appartment with a sea view.
But it was a great experience. I think i'll repeat it again.
Many thanks to the hotel team they was so helpful.
reviews.title: Good hotel

photos.caption:
Sunset from my room at jeddah hotel
Alexandria

reviews.text: The only redeeming thing about this hotel is its fantastic sea views. Otherwise, I wouldn't advise staying there for longer than one night if you can help it. The rooms are clean but bleak and depressing and there is cracked wall paint everywhere. The door locks are flimsy and difficult to work out and on our last morning there one co-traveller came back to her room to find that the cleaners had left it open with all her belongings in it. Downstairs in the restaurant a small trickle in the ceiling developed into a waterfall and the service overall was lame. I saw disgruntled guests yelling at the reception staff on more than one occasion. Good material if you're looking to write your next great novel but otherwise stay away until the hotel manager realises that s/he can run a cheap hotel efficiently and cleverly with just a bit of extra effort and maintenance.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.text: تجربتي في هذا الفنق رائعة  تعاملهم رائع ومرحبين بطريقة جميلة ولطيفة --- منظر البحر خلاب ولان الفندق على البحر مباشرة فترى انعكاس الفجر على البحر وجمال الغروب  الاكل جيد والطعم تحفة والغرف جيدة والاسرة نظيفه ودافئة لاني زرتهم في الشتاء -- اود ان اشكر جميع العاملين من فنيين(لاصلاحهم السريع خلل الشاشة ) وريسبشن وادارة ومطعم وخدمة الغرف وكامل التقدير للحاج محمد الصيرفي والريسبشن وعماد من المطعم -- اكلت اجمل تتبيلة دجاج
reviews.title: تشعر بالاهتمام من قبل كل الكادر والعاملين والادارة

reviews.text: الخدمة في منتهي الاحترام والمكان رائع جدا علي البحر مباشرة .يعني الغروب قدام عينك والهواء جميل جدا .والأكل جميل الفطار  حاجة محترمة ....والغداء خارج الحساب.بيس نضيف وشيق جدا وسعره في المتناول .والنظافة عالية والإدارة في منتهي الاحترام.ربنا يوفقكم .
reviews.title: 137 طريق الجيش سبورتنج

reviews.text:
من اجمل فنادق جدة حيث يقع مقابل الواجهة البحرية, قريب من كثير من المطاعم ومن اغلب المولات في المنطقة 
مساحة الغرفة واسعة باطلالة جميلة وحمام واسع مع جاكوزي وحمام بخار.
الموظفيين جميعهم لطفاء وخدومين ان كان الاستقبال او خدمات الغرف
reviews.title: اطلالة خلابة على البحر الاحمر

reviews.text:
احنا قعدنا ليلة واحدة الفندق متواضع جدا وامكانيات ضعيفة و ريحة البيرسول والمبيدات الحشرية بالفندق حاجة اوفر جدا الواي فاي ضعيف جدا جدا جدا المروحة الموجودة بالغرفة ضعيفة جدا احسن حاجة هو منظر البحر من البلكون
لا انصح به ع الاطلاق
reviews.title: فندق جدة الاسكندرية

reviews.text:
La situation face à la corniche et non loin du coeur d'Alexandrie en font un hotel à proximité des principaux points (monuments, quartiers historiques, mer) de cette ville.
Cependant la chambre présentait un certain nombre de défauts tels que la surface limité, l'absence de rideau de bain ou encore les incessantes coupures internet .
reviews.title: Hotel agréable, mais présentant quelques défauts

reviews.text: الفندق جيد  الإفطار متواضع الغرف نظيفة الحمام ضيق و لاتوجد منشفة موقع الفندق علي البحر مباشرة طاقم الضيافة جيد  أثاث الغرف مرضي قريب من  سط البلد  لاتوجد وسائد أو أغطية إضافية في الخزانة لايوجد مكيف هواء في الغرفة
reviews.title: Good

reviews.text: الفندق بموقع مناسب.واطلالة الغرف على البحر رائعة:وخصوصا من الدور الرابع.المطعم مطل على البحر:الافطار جيد.ولكنه  بسيط ومتكرر يوميا.طاقم العمل وخصوصا في المطعم:قمة في الذوق والتفاني.الغرف نظيفة ولكن جدرانها قديمة تساقط من عليها الدهان في بعض اجزاءها.الحمام نظيف بالطبع:يعيبه ان المياه في الشتاء تنزل من الدش محرقة:فيجب ان ينتبهوا لهذا.مجملا اعجبني الاطلالة  الرائعة المميزةوالموقع .وعموما هو جيد
reviews.title: موقع مناسب

reviews.text:
السلام عليكم ورحمة الله وبركاتة مساء الخير 
الفندق متوسط الحال يعيبه الزحام في المنطقة المحيطة والغرف تحتاج لإهتمام في النظافة وتغيير الفرش والأثاث الفطور متكرر يحتاج الى تنويع وتحسين والطاقم خدوم ويتفاني في عملة

reviews.text:
كان رائعاً جداً طاقم الإستقبال ، وما يحتويه من فحاوة إستقبال ومعاملة حسنة جداً .. رغم عدم تمكني من الإقامة به إلا وهم في قمة الروعة في حسن الضيافة ، وهذا إن دل فهو يدل على الإدارة المنضبطة والحسنة في معاملة الزبون لتمكينه من الإقامة على اكمل وجه .
فتحية شكر وتقدير لهم .

There are no restrictions whatsoever 
The food buffet is the worst ever it got empty and no refills 
The restrooms are not clean .towels not clean

Beach is very very very very far from the rooms

It's better to avoid weekends it will be just you over there
reviews.title: Day Use

reviews.text: It was Very good hotel with clean rooms and very kind staff working there. It is close enough to Alexandria and to the sea so well. It has very good breakfast and food with plenty of different dishes.
reviews.title: Business trip

reviews.text: Located near Alexandria International Airport. It's a neat and clean hotel with decent breakfast. It has a huge property. And we saw a group of high school SOCCER players and Tennis Players visiting this facilty. Recommend for family with kids.
reviews.title: Near the airport

locations.name: TOLIP Family Club Borg El Arab Hotel

reviews.text:
Very good hotel.
Good location for wood business trip  in  Alexandria.  Situated at 15 minutes by car from the Borg El Arab Airport and 15 minutes by car from the Timber trade area Alexandria.  The only problem remain the distance from korniche abt 90 minutes by car. The rest is ok. More then ok.
reviews.title: Business trip to Alexandria

locations.name: TOLIP Family Club Borg El Arab Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed one night in this hotel , it doesn't deserve 5 star the furniture is old and the room was not clean enough. the resturant staff were friendly and helpful and the food was good , the  receptionist were friendly.
reviews.title: Not 5* hotel

locations.name: TOLIP Family Club Borg El Arab Hotel
TOLIP Family Club Borg El Arab Hotel

reviews.text:
When we got to the hotel, they were very welcoming, and they gave us a welcome drink.
Then we went to our suite, where we found the AC not working and the telephone not working as well. So we went downstrairs to tell them, and they said they would come in 10mns to get everything fixed.. we waited for so long, got upset and went to tell them once again. So they switched our suite to another one where the AC and telephone (ordinary services in any hotel in the world) were luckily working well. But this time the refrigirator was broken.. we didn't complain this time because we were tired of complaining.
The only reason i gave this hotel a 2 stars, is because the reception boy called "Begad" was very decent, and a complimentary dessert was sent to our room.
Breakfast, was simple, although some of the food was not fresh, but we liked the view from the window, and the atmosphere.
reviews.title: Disappointed  !

reviews.text:
1. The bed blankets and bed linens were dirty and "yellowish" in color.
2. The towels contained hair and were dirty full of brown and black dirt spots that I was disgusted to even put them on my body
3. The water (shower and tap) doesn't last more than 20 seconds before it disappears. You have to wait for like two minutes before the water comes back at a very high speed and extremely hot.
I used to take my shower on 6 attempts stepping in and out of the shower to avoid the hot water burning my body.
4. I contacted the reception 3 times complaining about the issue but they didn't do any recognized effort to fix the issue rather than sending me a helpless plumber with no added value to the problem.
5. I ordered a 100 LE grilled chicken plate, the chicken was barely grilled. I was able to see the white flesh really easy.
6. I ordered two sandwiches, they came as if they are coming straight from the fridge.
7. When I asked to talk to the Hotel Manager, I was left for more than 15 minutes waiting for him to come.
What I recognized later is that in these 15 minutes, the staff went and talked to him that I dont have the right to complain because they did so and so.
When i told him my complains, he couldn't care less about any of my complains and all of his care was to drift the problem on me.
He told me I should've asked to change the room and that he doesn't have any problems with this happening.
He was totally fine with the water issue and just told me they'll look into it.
He ended his talk with me with the following statement: "What do you want from me now" in a sarcastic way which is really rude and defines how poor their management really is.
When I told him I'll fill all these things in my review on Booking, he told me go on, do whatever you want.
I really recommend not to stay at this place, its dirty, unprofessional and their manager is extremely rude.
reviews.title: The worst hotel I've ever been to in my whole life.

reviews.text: Very good  hotel,it had an amazing view with tidy rooms,three types of view the best to get swimming pool with corniche موقف  رائع جدا نظافة الغرفة على مستوى عال والعاملين فعلا اصحاب خبرة فندق يستحق أن يكون فندق المضل
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: اسوء تعامل واسوء ادارة وتعامل لايليق بمستوي النجوم الممنوحة له لايوجد مصداقية فالتعامل وخاصتا الاستقبال ويبلغك باسعار وعند الوصول يتم تغيرها وعند الاستفسار عن السبب تغير الاسعار يتم الرد ان المدير مش عاجبه الاسعار المعلنة من الاستقبال فلا انصح احد بالتعامل مع فندق بهذا المستوي من الادارة لا يوجد بيها مصداقية مما يضر بترتيباتك لاستمتاع بالاجازة وضايع الوقت

name: Hotel Transit Alexandria
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.
address: 1 Gamal Al Deen Yassin St. Raml Station, Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text:
Good hotel to stay in. Value for money.

1. Friendly and efficient Staff at the hotel.
2. Food was good and room was small but clean and comfortable.
3. It's located conveniently in mid of the busy market street and only few meters away from the Nile corniche. 

I would recommend to stay at this place.
reviews.title: Good Stay!!!

reviews.text:
Our experiences in this Hotel were poor. It was the staff who were totally unconcerned that made it worse. Only Ahmed who although ill tried to make our stay comfortable.
The entire hotel particularly the Entrance and the dining are are in a total disarray, there is stuff thrown in all over the place. The place was dusty and the sofas did not even have a covers and we sat on foam in the heat. 
Our room needed a coat of paint. The room and the beds were clean, although the after a shower the bathroom flooded. However, what was amazing was the location and the view of the Mediterranean which was almost touching the room. Amazing.
The most disgusting part of Hotel Transit was the staff rude and uncouth totally at odds with the extreme hospitality of the Egyptian people. 
This place seemed more for longtime residents but that is not an excuse for the rudeness of the staff and the owner.
reviews.title: I would go to this Hotel only for its View

reviews.text: I spent one of the most horrible nights if my life in this "hotel". The room that we got was so loud, that it was literally like beeing in the middle of the street.the elevator was falling apart and the photos that they post in the internet doesn't fir to the reality of the place. our room was equipped with a bathroom, but the water of our bathroom didnt worked, so we couldn't take a shower and the bathroom was precary build in the room.
reviews.title: the worst place I've ever stayed

reviews.text: Really i enjoyed staying at this hotel, however i booked only night but it was perfect the high response when i asked for blanket was as excpected , room clean, bathroom well prepared, location is super, i really recommend this hostel aginst littel money
reviews.title: Awsome hotel

reviews.text:
Its Location was the main reason to select this property to stay. Staff is good. They are having kitchen and you can cook anything you want.

Room was very noisy and chair was too dirty. Shower holder was broken. Door lock was ordinary and could be broken on a simple hard push. But it was pretty safe and secure so no need to worry.
Property is at 4th floor and sometimes lift is not working which could give you hard time when you will be with your luggage. It was hard time for me when I reached here & it was power cut. It was completely dark there and I had to carry my luggage to the 4th floor as lift was not working.
reviews.title: Best location, average services

reviews.text:
We stayed there for 4 nights to visit Alexandria and it's sights. We have choosen this hotel because it was cheap and located quite good.

The things we liked:
* VERY friendly and helpful staff
* simple but good breakfast
* excellent location (5 min. walking to Cornish, 15 min. to train station and 15-20 minutes to all major sights by taxi  

What we didn't like:
* not every room has an AC
* the window didn't close properly allowing heat to come in
* the shower head was broken when we arrived and hasn't been changed
* the elevator in the building is so old that one must be afraid it will stop
* the street in front of the hotel is a main road, which means it's VERY loud from 05am to 12pm

It was good enough for a cpuple of days if you consider the cheap price. Still, we're not recommending it.
reviews.title: Good enough

reviews.text:
for me as a packbacker i just want a clean room and a safe place to leave my luggage if you are look like me just go and stay with them.

special thanks for khaled who show me around,i enjoyed  alexandria alot this time , they accept me as a solo girl travlering however to many places in alexandria refuse that,

everything was near by me the sea almost 30 second,,, food resutrant , and it's nearby a good desert cafe called deleses you should try it ..ovelall it's a good place for you if u were on budget,
reviews.title: A perfect place and the location was awesome

reviews.text:
Hotel location is good, very close to Raml Station, right behind Steingenberger Cecil hotel and by sea promenade. Close to everything in the centre of Alexandria. Hotel is nothing special, but good enough for sleeping, with aircondition and comfortable beds.
Rooms need to be renovated, because walls are crumbling, paint and plaster flaking off, mould starting to take hold, toilet would continually fill itself. Breakfast was okay but not will not get asked what you want, they bring you boiled eggs, bread, butter and tea. Be aware of very noisy road until late. Elevator in the building is disaster. We paid 45 euro for 3 persons for 2 nights and for this money hotel is good enough.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text:
We booked a night in this hotel last night which was a triple room . When we arrived at the hotel we were shocked to see torn sofas which were stained . To our utmost dismay we did not have an option to change the hotel as it was booked 
When we landed in our room it was stinking with strange smell like moth . The walls were peeled and dirty . The bed linen was stained and disgusting 

The bathroom stank and the shower and the pot faucet had no water ! Go figure how does any one go so wrong from the pictures to the actual place . Pls don’t be cheated by the photoshopped pictures . This place is not worth it even if they offered you free 
We had to put our clothes on the bed on top of me linen to sleep 

I hope you take my experience seriously and not venture and be disappointed 

We traveled 14 hours from marsalam and checked in and slept and first thing in the morning checkout
reviews.title: Don’t go on the pictures it’s a run down shamble

reviews.text: I visited the hotel again but was shocked with the changes , first a room with no fidge , a bathroom  smelling so bad and the  douche not working at all and they fixed it after I complained the painting of the room falling on beds our bags and everything in short it was so different than my last visit ,no water all night and no Wi-Fi just a fake connection with no connectivity .
reviews.title: I'll never come back

reviews.text: My dad and I really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is in a good location - it is next to Saad zaghloul park so it is easy to get back to if you manage to get lost. You can walk to the fort at qaitbey and the library of Alexandria along the water. The room was clean spacious and had a view of the city. The shower had warm water. The wifi was good. Yes the elevator is a old but it works and it's some fun too. The breakfast was basic and fills you up for the day. The staff were really lovely and booked an uber for us to the bus stop when leaving. Overall we were impressed by the hotel with such an affordable price!
reviews.title: Brilliant budget hotel

reviews.text:
Spent three days at the Transit.  Fourth floor, lift with no doors (out of action 3-5pm each day.  Very close to Raml tram station with a regular service to other parts of Alex including the rail station.  Fare is only 1 Egyptian pound (around 5p).  Busy streets below are noisy but shutters and window shut out most of it.  They take any currency (including Egyptian).  A simple breakfast is included (Egg, cheese,  jam and bread with tea or coffee.  Lots of shops and restaurants close by and along the corniche.  From some rooms you can see the Med.  Typical rooms are twin and triples with ensuite toilet, basin and shower (hot water from immersion heater).  All with AC, fan, TV, ample storage space .  Wifi is free and good quality.  Some rooms have a fridge.
Helpful staff who speak basic English.  Rooms and bedding are clean.  Towels provided
reviews.title: Cheap, basic, cheerful, very good location in Alex

reviews.text:
pro: clean room, the owner is friendly and helpful

con: the place need a total renovation, it is located on the 4th floor and the elevator is very old and scary and the stairs dirty. one of the staff members smokes a lot we could even smell it in our room, no heater, scary building
reviews.title: needs a total renovation, not what we expected

reviews.text: Transit hotel is economic small hotel with clean and suitable rooms.my room was with an excellent view.it suitable if u search for room to sleep in while you are visiting Alex all the day. It just need some maintenace activity to be very good one
reviews.title: Suitable, clean rooms

reviews.text: Old TV, we had to wake up the guy at the reception to serve us the breakfast. Shower and toilet together, so when you shower everything gets wet. We ordered double bed, they gave us two individuals. We booked it for two nights but we left to another hotel across the street where we pay almost half the price and receive a better room.

address: Km 1.5 Borg El-Arab Hwy King Marriout, Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text: The hotel was nice , cozy , but needs lots of renovation. Furniture, rugs and chairs need to be renewed. The pool was very good and the food in the restaurant was really  tasty . Unfortunately the playing area had lots of ants and my kids were afraid to play there. The whole experience was good ,thank you.

reviews.text:
The place is secluded, and the staff are mostly helpful. The rooms are clean, and the food is good. There are many venues in-house to entertain you, pool, gym, spa, and the restaurant and bar. 
The price/value offered, is a bit exaggerated, due to the recent inflation...
reviews.title: Visit it occasionally, as a guest, and had stayed inn many times

reviews.text:
I actually started one day at Adham Compound Hotel , the hotel in general is a good hotel, the staff are really good , nice and testy food , the room quite big one but the furniture date out need to be updated , the Internet in the room very weak.
I recommend this hotel for a short stay.

reviews.title: One of the best hotels in the area

reviews.text: Nice place to stay during business, friendly staff, good food, near to the industrial zone in Alexandria and near to the road to Cairo but I prefer it in summer to enjoy the swimming pool after long day work
reviews.title: Production Manager

reviews.text:
Steped down there for 4 nights due to business in the area.
Decent big rooms and a nice poolbar which also serves food from the closeby restaurant. Quality is ok.
The best, however, is the gym, it's allone worth the stay. They even have indoor racing track and everything to stay in shape. 5US additionally is fine..
The area is not so good. The hotel is a gated community in the middle of nowhere.
Personel could be a bit more motivated..
Overall I give 3 out of 5..
reviews.title: ok, for a view days, top gym..

reviews.text: Nice enough Hotel - close to the Airport (30 mins) and also close to the SUMED Oil Terminal. Staff very friendly and most speak good English. Rooms are a little dated but all clean. Food is ok and passable for the price. You are in the middle of the industrial area - refinery across the road and busy trucking road outside.
reviews.title: Decent for the price

reviews.text: it's just amazing how ACH or adham compound hotel is my first choice when i have a 2 night stay near alex .. i have been there 3 times till and every time; it just meets my expectations ... the rooms are clean, the breakfast buffet is good and u can go for a swim in their nice pool. i will love to go there again soon
reviews.title: Always my choice

reviews.text: Our company have rented an Apartment here for several years so we are well aquainted with the Adham and its Staff. We are always made most welcome by the Staff who attempt in their Egyptian way to look after us well. Please be aware that this is not a typically 'tourist' hotel but more befitting that of a location where visiting foreign workers who are working in the local area / Refinery / Freezone can stay and use it as a central location to avoid the heavy traffic of downtown Alexandria. The Staff are courteous and try to assist where they can, language difficulties can pose a problem at times, remember, you are in Egypt and Arabic is their native tongue! Facilities are good, what would appear to be a well equipped Gym (never visited so cannot comment further!) with an indoor running track, never seen one anywhere else before! Jacuzzi, Sauna, Massage all available, Pool area has been renovated over the Winter so is now freshened up, new Loungers also arrived not long ago. Gardens are well tended and the place abounds with flowers! Bars present with various Drinks available including European brands, Shisha Garden also present where you can have a Shisha overlooking the Tennis Court, Table Tennis also available. Food is generally of a high standard with a large and varied Menu choice, Silver Spoons Restaurant on site also very popular. Hotel itself has 24/7 Security so feels very relaxed and secure. It is located next to a busy road however road noise is not a great issue.
reviews.title: Excellent location for Business Travellers

reviews.text:
Adham hotel is excellent value for money. Situated very close to the “Free Zone” zone and the oil refinery.
The rooms are clean and tidy, for an Egyptian hotel they are very good.
The bar area has pool tables and televisions for sport. Food at the hotel is of a western standard, and is of excellent, Steaks & Pasta a speciality. The staff are very friendly, courteous and helpful.
The fitness room is large with an indoor running track, and excellently equipped with instruments of torture, the sauna / whirlpool is good in the winter, the massage is excellent.
The outside pool could not be used due inclement weather, however the pool area is well equipped with tables chairs and deck-beds.
I would however suggest that anyone visiting the area be prepared with plenty of mosquito spray.
reviews.title: A very good business hotel

reviews.text: I stayed for one night, my team stayed for couple of weeks, rooms are spacious and double, pool view, clean, old fashioned for some how. It's tailored for expats working in the area, the only incompetent thing is the food, very humble and not tasty at all with limited varieties.
reviews.title: Good location near business are of Borg Al-Arab

name: El Omda Hotel
address: Km 21, Alex Matrouh Rd. Agami, Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text: Nous avons testé cet Hôtel au mois d'avril 2018, et vu que le teste était très concluant , c'est avec beaucoup de plaisir que nous y sommes retournés pour fêter nos noces d'argent , et mon anniversaire le 1.10.
reviews.title: Mon anniversaire et anniversaire de mariage

name: El Loualoaa Hotel
address: 2 Mostafa Naguib St. Miami, Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text:
الفندق هادئ طول اليوم نتيجة لأن نزلاء الفندق بنسبة كبيرة من العائلات والفندق من الفئة المتوسطة لذلك ستجد أن أثاث الغرف والأجنحة متوسط وكذلك كماليات الغرفة من تكييف الهواء الخ. لكن فندق اللؤلؤة هو أحسن اختيار في تلك الفئة حيث أن الغرف دائما نظيفة ومرتبة وكذلك الحمام وتعامل طاقم العمل قمة في الاحترام والأدب. تتعدد أماكن الإقامة ما بين غرف صغيرة أو أجنحة كبيرة تسع ستة أفراد وربما توجد أجنحة أكبر. الافطار مصري جميل يحتوي على جبن ومربى وشاي وخبز وفول وبيض مسلوق وعسل.الاجنحة والغرف لا ترى البحر بشكل واضح لأن موقع الفندق في نهاية شارع قصير متفرع من الكورنيش مباشرة أي أن الجزء الجانبي من بعض الشرفات يسمح برؤية متواضعة جدا للبحر والكورنيش ولكن البحر والكورنيش على بعد خطوات قليلة. أهم المعالم القريبة هي شاطئ القوات المسلحة وشاطئ البوريفاج وشارع خالد بن الوليد.

خلاصة التقييم ... صحيح أن فندق اللؤلؤة متوسط ولكن دائما ما يحاول العاملون به أن يرتقوا بالفندق للفئة أعلى من المتوسط. فندق اللؤلؤة هو خيارك الأمثل إذا أردت تحقيق معادلة الراحة والنظافة والهدوء والاحترام مع السعر المتوسط.
reviews.title: خلف سنترال ميامي

reviews.text:
فندق ممتاز جدا...معاملة راقيه ....مجهودات من القائمين علية لراحة النزلاء...اسعار معقوله...يحرص على تجديد وتطوير نفسة ..نجمتين فقط..وهو يستحق اكثر من ذلك..بجد...لن تندموا فى الاقامة به..شكر خاص أ.اسلام ومدام ليلى 
شكرا لفندق اللؤلؤة
reviews.title: شبرا القاهرة

reviews.text: فندق سيئ جداااااااااااا ومقابله الريسبشن زفتتت وريحت الاوض وحشه جدا ومافيهاش تهويه اكننا في سجن والنضافه سيئه وفندق قديييييم والكنب الريسبشن متبهدل ومتكسر حاجه تقرف بجد ...اسؤ فندق شوفته بحياتي حرام يتقال عليه فندق ده البنسيون انضف منه

reviews.text: I had stayed in this hotel with my wife.. Firstly they are one family managed the hotel.. You will feel free when you open your balcony and see the sea specially in the sunset... The hotel located in a unique building reminds me that I travelled to the 50ths... The room is very cozy and not very big but comfortable and if you have any problems in the room, they can fix it immediately... The owner is very kind and helpful person always welcome the guests.. The staff is very friendly and helpful.. I didn't book the room with the breakfast but if I wanted any drinks, they can bring it to your room with extra charge not expensive... Great people and great location in the centre of the city.. Very recommended... Big thanks for all the staff and I will return soon to this lovely place

This is the hotel where one of the most famous novels for Naguib Mahfouz ( Nobel prize winner 1988) took place. The name was Miramar pension, currently its called Fouad hotel.

في هذا الفندق دارت أحداث رواية (ميرمار) للكاتب العظيم نجيب محفوظ . الحائز على جائزة نوبل للآداب عام ١٩٨٨
reviews.title: Famous hotel

reviews.text:
Like all other hotels in downtown, the location in perfect for moving around. sea view room are nice for the view only. rooms are small and cozy but the level of cleanness is not that much. during our stay (one night only!) there was an attack from ants almost all around in the room
breakfast is very weak
toilets are a closed space within the room
reviews.title: One night stay only hotel

reviews.text:
the place offers great sea view and its location is perfect in downtown Alexandria, however it can't be classified as Hotel, its rather a lodging house, its run by a family who live in the same place and practice their social life -like having a birthday party till late- regardless the guests who were trying to have some sleep after long day.
The breakfast served in room but it was very poor.
The price is very high comparing the provided services. 
the rooms are clean but there is no housekeeping.
the place can use some maintenance and more modern management to utilize its perfect location.
reviews.title: Lodging house Not Hotel

reviews.text: If you like a room with a balcony facing the Mediterranean sea and the Cornish in Alexandria without spending choose Fouad hotel. The Egypt hotel whitch is mentioned in the latest Lonely Planet guide is closed but Fouad is in the same building just one flor below and is a perfect substitute
reviews.title: Room with a veiw

reviews.text: I got into town later than expected arriving at about 5:30 am.  Although they had my phone number they didn't mention anything until I arrived with a lot of heavy bags.  At first they said my reservation was cancelled but they could show me a different room.  I asked if it would be the same price, and the tall guy working said yes, then after I put my things in the room he said it would be a lot more.  Later after I left they claimed to Booking.com that I never showed up.
reviews.title: They didn't honor my reservation because they said I arrived too late.

reviews.text: Vintage hostel right infront of the Mediterranean corniche, very reasonable and in the middle of the city, where public transportation is around you, the breakfast was very basic though (Eggs, jam, cheese and tea)
reviews.title: Vintage lovely hostel

reviews.text:
This hotel is on the second floor of one of the beautiful Italian style hotels on the Corniche in Alexandria. The entrance is off one of the side streets and looms s little sketchy, but the interior of the hotel has s beautiful Italian style. 

Checking in was fine. The desk person spoke a little English. We got a small room with a view of the harbor. 

The rooms are small, and harken back to an older time when travelers shares Bathrooms with the whole hotel. They have done a pretty good job installing a self contained bathroom in our small room. Essentially it was a metal box with beaded glass windows, a toilet and a sink. The whole thing was the shower. Not too bad, but there were no towels in the room.

The beds and pillows were hard. Some folks wouldn't like that, but it'd isn't bother me. I didn't find an air conditioner control, but they have a nice ceiling fan and I stayed cool on a hot night. 

There was a small refrigerator in my room as well as a small tv with satellite. I didn't watch it, so I don't know what channels it had. 

It's an Egyptian hotel and seems to get mostly Egyptian guests these days. So, it's not really a place for picky western travelers. But it's a really good value in an historic hotel with a great, and I do mean great, view of the East Harbor in Alexandria.

It was great for my friend and I who traveled to do an overnight sightseeing trip.
reviews.title: A good view for a good deal

reviews.text:
The place was ok, not expensive and included breakfast. (Bread, egg, tea, jam, etc).

The wi-fi wasn't working, and the towels provided were a little threadbare. 

Good view of the bay from the balcony, but was noisy at night, both from inside the hotel and outside from the traffic.

Soap was provided, but no water, although there was a fridge and TV with English channels. The ensuite bathroom was small, and could do with regrouting the tiles. 

On the whole, not bad for an overnight trip.
reviews.title: Okay for a night or two

reviews.text: Very central located close to El Raml station and directly at the beautiful corniche. All rooms with balcony and sea view. Noisy because of traffic under. This place is only acceptable if you live in Egypt and are used to this standard. For the included breakfast you can wait looooong.....you have to knock at the (open!!) door of the room where the frontdesk woman sleeps in to wake her up and bring breakfast. She will send the bawab and he will bring it from a street imbiss. Shower without curtain, almost no water pressure, all the floor will be wet after showering. No room service. Bring your own towel, because the ones you get there are (sorry!) disgusting. There are other hotels where you get better accomodation for the same price.
reviews.title: very local hotel for not picky people

reviews.text: It was clean and the hosts were friendly. The family who owns it seems to live in it as well. They were a little noisy the night we stayed but the traffic was equally as noisy out the window. It's not fancy by any means but if you're really on a budget it's a good pick.
reviews.title: Great for budget traveling

reviews.text: واجهة بحر وهى احسن ما فى البنسيون الصغير .. غير هذا لايصلح ان يطلق عليه فندق .. السعر مرتفع ومبالغ فيها بالنسبة لما يقدمه من خدمات ... الموقع فى وسط الاسكندرية وقريبة من المواصلات واماكن الزيارة .... العمارة التى بها الفندق قديمة ومتهالكة والمصعد فى حالة يرثى لها
reviews.title: بنسيون صغير لايطلق عليه فندق

reviews.text: Vraiment une vue panoramique très magnifique  le service est acceptable par rapport aux prix, très près de tous les lieux importants à Alexandrie, la chose la plus importante que vous pouvez sentir l'odeur du beau temps là bas merci infiniment pour les responsables de l'hôtel
reviews.title: Dr Mohamed  El Hanafy

reviews.text:
الفندق نظيف و اقتصادي ، المنظر رائع  .

الأسعار أقل من المعروض في البرامج لذا أفضل الحجز عبر الهاتف

* تغطية الهاتف المحمول كانت ضعيفة في الغرفة الثانية 
*الفندق قريب من الشارع لذا أصوات السيارات  كانت مزعجة قليلاً
سأختار نفس الفندق في المرة القادمة

 سأختار نفس الفندق مجددا في المرة القادمة
reviews.title: الاسكندريه

reviews.text:
كاف جداً لليلة أو ليلتين
لقد كان لا بأس بها، غير مكلف، الإفطار
خبز، بيض، شاي، المربى، إلخ
 المناشف والأغطية والفراش كانت صغيرة.
جيد تطل على الخليج من الشرفة
 ولكنها كانت مزعجة ليلا، سواء من داخل الفندق
خارج عن حركة المرور.
كان الصابون، ولكن لا يوجد مياه
 على الرغم من أنه على ثلاجة صغيرة 
وتلفزيون مع قنوات باللغة الإنجليزية
 الحمام الداخلى كانت صغيرة
ويمكن أن 
فى المجمل، لم يكن سيئا بالنسبة
 لإقامة ليلة واحدة الرحلة.
شديدة المحلية 
مركزى للغاية يقع بالقرب 
من مركز المدينة 
  مباشرة على والكورنيش الجميل
كل الغرف بها شرفات 
و منظر على البحر.
 مزعجة بسبب المرور تحت
هذا المكان هو فقط مقبول 
إذا كنت تعيش في مصر على هذا المستوى
 على الإفطار يمكنك الانتظار
لا يوجد خدمة الغرف.
 إحضار منشفتك الخاصة بك،
هناك فنادق أخرى حيث يمكنك الحصول 
على أفضل محل إقامة بنفس السعر.
reviews.title: كاف جداً لليلة أو ليلتين

name: Ithaka Hostel
address: 148 Al Ahram, Al Mansheyah Al Kubra, Mansheya building 70, Apartment 8, 2nd floor, Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text:
Ithaka has to be one of the best hostels in Egypt. It’s also probably one of the most expensive, being the only real hostel in Alexandria - which is pricier than most of Egypt in general - but for the quality I’d say it’s worth it.

Located on the 2nd floor of a building right on the seafront, it’s directly halfway between the Citadel of Qaitbay and the Library, and right above or close to lots of nice Egyptian-style cafes (the city is known for its cafe culture). The railway station is a 20 minute walk so nice and close.

The hostel is clean and modern and colourful, with a terrific common area (half of which is sadly given over to smokers, smoking indoors is the norm in Egypt), and is also filled with cushions, books and games. The bathrooms are large and were usually in a good state. Check-in and WiFi access is done via scanning a QR code so very modern, and the dorm has great AC (although it was a little too cold at times) with great beds which have two fab pillows and blankets (!) and an under-bed locker which you are given a padlock for (a 100 LE deposit is taken for this). There is also a “mini-market” tuckshop in reception where you can buy cheap snacks and drinks.

The breakfast is terrific - tea or coffee with a mixed plate of flatbread, Egyptian beans, cream cheese,  cucumber, fried egg and a sweet cereal bar. Laundry can be done for 30 LE which is a great price. The staff were all sweet and helpful.

Decent beaches aren’t plentiful in Alexandria but Stanli beach (under the Stanli bridge) isn’t bad, 25 LE entry, and you can easily take an Uber there. The Royal Jewellery Museum is close to there also, as is Gleem Bay, which has plenty of great modern cafes and restaurants.

Overall a fantastic stay, I’m sad I had to leave! Thank you guys!
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text:
I am so grateful to have stayed in Ithaka for my five days in Alexandria. This place really has everything you'd want from a hostel and more. It was easy to find and has a great, central location. The staff members are super welcoming and helpful. Everything was clean, tidy and well maintained. Very comfortable beds and sea view from the rooms. The common area is super cosy, and has a homey ambience that can be hard to come by when travelling. They've done a really great job at making it feel like a living room, and it's a perfect place to hang out (which I did a lot), either for socializing, working or just having a break from the city busy-ness. 

Otherwise, you get a great breakfast prepared by the staff in the morning and you can also use the kitchen to cook yourself - which is a huge plus. I've been to many hostels and found this one to have an absolutely lovely ambience about it. My fingers and toes are crossed that they'll soon expand to more areas in Egypt!
reviews.title: Absolutely loved this place

reviews.text: With a perfect location that has a direct sea view, cozy atmosphere done by the stuff, everything there was perfect. I spent my birthday vacation there and I really enjoyed it. The room is super clean, the food was nice, you can spend the night with them as they are your friends chatting, singing or watching a movie. Well done guys <3
reviews.title: The Cozy zone in Alexandria

reviews.text:
I like the whole atmosphere .
A cozy place where you feel like home.
Amazing and helpful staff.
The room is very convenient &the terrace view is priceless .
Free Wifi and delicious breakfast 
The location of the hostel is excellent.
reviews.title: A cozy place where you feel like home

reviews.text: My mates and I needed a place to spend the night on Alex. We booked our rooms at the hostel. We weren’t expecting a lot. And we were pleasantly surprised. The place is amazing. The look is clean and proper very homey, the people friendly the view relaxing and the facilities very accommodating!
reviews.title: Had a stay, loved the place!

reviews.text: This hostel is brand new so all facilities are top notch. Beds were really comfy, individual lockers are provided, and there are electrical sockets for each bed. Wifi was reliable. The free egyptian breakfast was also good. The staff were all warm and friendly. I love the layout in the common area, it’s a really great place to chill. The balcony offers a great view too especially during sunset. It’s quite far from the attractions in Alexandria, but that’s not a problem because public transport is real cheap and easily accessible on the main road. There’s not much atmosphere though which is understandable. That should change once word gets around on how awesome this place is.
reviews.title: Brand New Hostel

reviews.text: Placée au 10e étage.  On a une superbe vu sur la mer. Déjeuner inclu.  Chambre salle de bain prive et avec un avec bain. Cuisine avec toutes les commodité pour se faire à manger. Personnel extraordinaire.  Et serviable.
reviews.title: Excellent auberge

name: Egypt Hotel
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.
address: 1 Degla St., Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text: I stayed here with a tour group.  Rooms not very clean, bathroom dirty, awful beds , hard pillows and so much noise from the street that I had 4 hours of sleep.  A noisy tram line is in the street beside the hotel.  Great view but no sleep.  I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Very noisy no sleep

reviews.text:
A beautiful old hotel that overlooks the Mediterranean Sea.  Our room had a balcony with a fabulous view of the sea.  The hotel is on the third floor of a larger building.  You can take the stairs or a neat 100 year old cage elevator.  We stayed here two nights during a G-Adventures tour.  

The bathroom is very attractive.  But there is no tub and the shower head is simply sticking out of the wall.  When you shower you must leave your clean clothes, your dirty clothes, your towel, the trashcan, toilet paper and anything else you don't want to get wet outside the bathroom door.  Then after you shower, the bathroom floor is wet and you can't go in there in your stocking feet.

As part of the tour we were served a free breakfast in a small dining room.  They brought each of us a plate of food.  It consisted of a boiled egg, yogurt, cold cuts, cheeses, olives, tomatoes, cucumbers and bread.

The hotel is in a nice location.  Many restaurants and shops are nearby.  It is right on the water front, on the corniche.  It is on a busy road and crossing it can be a bit of a challenge.
reviews.title: A 5 star stay except for the shower.

photos.caption: Bathroom with the shower head sticking out of the wall.
The decorations on the bed is actually your bedding and you have to make your own bed.

reviews.text: Receiptionist is very helpful, a very good welcoming and preparing the room before you stay, the room is clean, not small comparing to the value you pay, air conditioned, had a private bathroom, tv, sheets, fridge, internal service phone & Closet. The view is incredible, awfully we just stayed 1 night and didn't had the time to enjoy it. The breakfast is moderate but the service is from the heart. We would come back very soon.
reviews.title: Staff, Clean & View

reviews.text: We had booked another hotel because online (booking.com) Egypt Hotel had no rooms available.  Since it was nearby the original place we booked, we decided to take a chance and stop in to make sure it was full.  Sure enough, the friendly desk staff assured us they did in fact have a room available.  We eagerly changed our reservation to this hotel.  We stayed for about a week and each day the staff was on point and friendly and going the extra mile to ensure we enjoyed our stay.  The room was small, but charming, clean and come on - the view!  The balcony opened up to an incredible view of the Eastern Harbour.  Should I ever make it back to this side of the world, no doubt I'll stay here again!
reviews.title: Great value and world class view!

reviews.text: Service  was very good ,workes was very helpfull . The room was clean but small. The view was fantastic best view you could have over the sea , overall i recommend it for another visits, thanks Egypt Hotel
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: Good location in Alexandria. Clean beds but pillows are as hard as rocks ,they actually hurt my neck lol. Ok breakfast. Nice decor in lobby, some row have good views. It's an ok hotel for a night or two. WiFi works in both lobby and rooms which is a huge plus!
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: This is a lovely piece of old Alexandria. We had a room with a view of the harbour. The room furniture, like the lobby furniture was all good quality, and harking back to earlier times. The hotel is really central, and anything you want to see is within easy walking distance. The plumbing works. The breakfast is fairly Egyptian, but ok.
reviews.title: Period piece with views

reviews.text:
Egypt hotel, 

July 21-23 ,2015, 70$ a night 
Try to have the Arabic address or the phone number it's not a hotel in and of it self, it's a building with a hotel on the 3rd floor. So yeah be patient or try to get their Arabic info before you go some advise it's 200m from Cecil hotel(any driver will know that, and towards library side of the bay not qaitbey side. There is no sign or name on the outside.

BUILDING
the building is beautiful(I've been to egypt before and live in China, so my standards may be adjusted appropriately , not so white washed like many) the elevator was only not working once but after it was fixed it didn't break again(I think they were doing electrical work in the building so MINUS 0 stars) the hotel worker came and met us at the bottom of the stairs and carried our bags.  The walk is easy don't be a baby. 

LOBBY
The lobby is one of the reasons to stay here, it's just beautiful and historic , my American eyes really appreciate the old European style, the worker who helped us check in was nice, I gave them some advice about putting the Arabic address on tripadvisor but he insisted its already there (if it's not MINUS 1/4 star for lying) 

CHECK-IN
 The check in took just 2 minutes , I was with my girlfriend (we're not Arabs so we can stay together without marriage certificate) we booked a double room single occupancy (what the heck booking.com, can you be more confusing?)  instead of making a problem and charging more(GOLDEN TULIP FLAMENCO) they said no problem, the wifi was beautifully fast(again I live in China I'm used to slow wifi) and free ( PLUS 1/4 star). He explained where and when was breakfast and gave us the key. We were able to pay with credit card.

THE ROOM
I would place it solidly Chinese 3 star Egyptian 3 star. Everything was clean and nothing was "OMG NO!" Alexandria doesn't have many good hotels right on the Bay, mostly older styles like this, the difference between a 30$ room and a 70$ room is the "ghetto factor" at this 70$ hotel there was nothing ghetto, I stayed at "ACROPOLE HOTEL ALEXANDRIA" when I was young and poor, about 12$ and they had one Electical outlet 2 meters off the ground and old peeling paint no ensuite restroom and a level of grime(although I love that place , go if you're  poor) this place has paint many electrical outlets and no ghetto factor.  The mini(1m tall) fridge worked well, made my diet Pepsi nice and frosty, there's a TV probably won't use, and the AC was powerful, I had to wake up at 3am and turn it off(I had it at 15C) big wardrobe for clothes and hangers all around good. The best was OK and the pillows were quite hard although I slept well.

THE VIEW 
The room seems just so so at first glance. But when the hotel boy( a 186cm 120kg Guy) opened the shutters and slid over the curtains and revealed the Bay I realized why this hotel is special. The balcony is large enough for 2 people and great place to dry your clothes (you will sweat in Alex!) you can see the whole crescent bay and Fort Qaitbey, 

LOCATION
The hotel is 8 mins from The Library of Alexandria and maybe 35 mins walk from Qaitbey(be smart take a microbus for 1/2 egp. Just yell qaitbey and if they nod get in, yell bibliotheca Alexandria if they nod get in. The hotel is close to KFC (super cheap compared to China idk USA never went) and close to a restaurant i like "abu nasser" ابو ناصر, good Egyptian food, and remember  the hotel is close to cecil hotel, just ask microbus "fundook Cecil?" then get in. It's a 7 minute walk to Amir cinema, we saw English movies(terminator genysis) with 3D glasses 60egp for 2. close to the Alex train station but I doubt many people will walk it(14 mins)

BREAKFAST
The breakfast is free and I loved it; it's one slice of beef lunch meat, some olives tomatoes cucumbers cheese butter and strawberry jam, coffee juice and a big basket of bread , the second day we got some Egyptian fuul, just like refried beans for the bread really good! And some hard boiled eggs, I enjoyed it a lot and yogurt! From 8-11 in a beautiful little dining area. 

RESTROOM 
The restroom had toilet paper and towels again "no ghetto factor" it is a traditional British W.C , so there is no glass door or curtain, so remove the toilet paper before you shower , the toilet paper goes down the toilet no problem, (always nice) and hot water was great(I took 15 min shower idk if it's very long )Hand soap included, I didn't see shampoo or conditioner, no tooth brush/paste

ANNOYANCES
 I stayed at 3 hotels this time in egypt and 5 total in my travels( Mena house, golden tulip flamenco, egypt hotel, Australian hostel, and ACROPOLE hotel) this egypt hotel and golden tulip are the only hotels who wouldn't call and order outside food for me "we have food here so we can not assist with outside orders" don't be a jerk guys sometimes when I want to take a nap or it's too late and Cairo or Alex isn't the safest at night(although realistically that may be an excuse I was just too tired to go out) you should help the guest order food, EVENTUALLY he did call back and say he will send the hotel guy(huge guy:P) to the restaurant for me and no service charge just tip if I want or no tip, I ordered and the hotel boy went out and the order was perfect receipt in bag and exact change I gave 10egp (be nice guys) and was happy but I was still annoyed he initially refused me(Minus 1/4 star the guest is always right!) , 

ANNOYANCES 2
the room had an auto locking door of sorts, when we went out they cleaned the room(thank you) but when I got back I noticed some glue/putty in the door that didn't allow it to go into the door and lock(I had to use the other lock which I had a key for) this is a common trick of robbers(putting him in the door and not allowing it to click shut, I was using the key to remove the putty when the manager asked if I had a problem , I asked what was the white stuff he explained while cleaning the wind kept blowing the door shut so they did that and the door wouldn't auto lock the key would be used on the inside lock, so MINUS 1/4 star for not telling me about this and making me worry I was the victim of a crime. 

POSITIVES
The front desk worker was happy to answer all my questions about the area and how to reach certain places, each time we returned to the lobby we got a smile and a "did you enjoy your outing" , when we checked out they had a taxi driver waiting in the lobby who took us to the station for 30egp not a good deal but I paid 60$ at Mena House for their airport services. So everything is relative. 

OVERALL FEELING
If you don't like boring WHITE AND SQUARE hotels get this place the location is perfect, the workers friendly, and the wifi and room clean and good, just depends where you are in life, student get ACROPOLE young adult get Egypt Hotel, older and don't want any annoyances get Mercure or Cecil(I'm not a fan of Hilton or Four Seasons, my definition of White and Square, I don't spend good money to stay in my grandmas house, maybe if you USA culture or architecture is interesting to you try the Hilton or Four Seasons, ) but if you want French Colonial and a beautiful sea view for less than 80$ feel free to stay at Egypt Hotel, just be prepared to find it first. 

STARS 3.75 

PLUS
+ location
+ balcony 
+ clean
+ wifi
+ free simple breakfast
+ good English and helpful

MINUS
- hard to find(took extra 15 mins of driver stopping and asking, and that was with the picture of the building I had on my phone)
- service doesn't kiss your bum
- I had to push my 2 beds together by myself(I'm sure hotel boy would've done it)
 That's about it I'm a simple guy who just wants smiles and good service I do my job well and expect good work from others, if you enjoy my reviews please let me know I enjoy writing them and if you have any questions about Egypt(Cairo and Alex)  or China(ie. Beijing/hongkong ) please feel free to ask me, I'm here to help. 
This is my digital diary of sorts I look forward to seeing the progressions fm changes that occur through my years of traveling hopefully the rooms get nicer and the experiences more profound.
reviews.title: 3.75 stars, July 21-23,2015

reviews.text:
Mahfouz's classic novel "Miramar" takes place in a pension in Alexandria, and Egypt Hotel brought the book to mind the second I stepped into the lobby. It oozes "old Alexandria" and I was disappointed that the person in charge was NOT a stout, aging Greek landlady dressed in black; instead he was a very smart, efficient, helpful young Egyptian guy. OK, so I wasn't disappointed in that; but I would have liked to have seen a little old Greek landlady nonetheless.

Yes, there are some "quirks" to the place; wi-fi in name only, miniscule shower space, etc. But the ancient elevator lends atmosphere and you couldn't ask for a better location. I enjoyed the place thoroughly.
reviews.title: Great place for "the Alexandria Experince"

reviews.text:
My stay in this hotel was arranged  by the agents of my company in Egypt . When I was taken to the hotel , the look of its exterior was such that  I told  my contact that I could not stay there , but he persuaded me to have a look before I decided. ( The exterior is in quite a bad shape  - viewed  from the entry ). The building is a heritage structure and must have been a grand structure in its prime. 
There is an antique elevator that  takes us up to the Hotel Floor  . The hotel interiors are quite a contrast to the dull and faded  exterior. The staff is very friendly and very pleasant.  
The room i took was sea facing , The view is very nice and there is a very strong breeze in the evening . The hustle and bustle of the road below  is quite an interesting sight .
The room is not  modern but has a very  old world charm to it . There is a bit of noise in the mornings and evening time as the road below is quite busy,but by around 10 pm the traffic is very less and it is not noisy . 
The location is amazing with the promenade in front and lot of places to eat , shops etc located very nearby. 
The hotel does not have a restaurant but they serve food in the dining room . They have a dinner menu which is mostly continental / french cuisine names ( did not try so cant say if it is localized or the real deal ). I requested them to get me some local  items instead as I was too tired to go out and eat . They were very  happy to help and got me some of the local food items and it was a huge helping and very reasonably priced. 
They have Free wifi but it was not working in the rooms properly , had to sit in the lobby to use it . They were installing additional routers  for better signal strength and it must be set up by now. 
The breakfast is a fixed menu meal, it is a pretty good helping but nothing to talk about. 
The staff was very helpful and gave suggestions on shopping and how to avoid getting overcharged etc. 
Overall In spite of my initial horror at seeing the exterior  I was happy with the experience at the hotel. Do not expect much form the place facilities available are basic but the location is very good and the  staff is very  nice . 

(Carry adapters for charging your  devices - all the points are two pin round . )
reviews.title: Location ! Location !

reviews.text:
Checkin was fast. Its a small room with a nice view. Room was clean. Bathroom was clean.
Bed was generally clean. There was dry stain on the pillow sheet but it not very visible, like it was washed over and over but wouldn't come out. Hot water in the shower lasts 15-20 MAX, so be quick. Maybe it was our room that had a bad water heater in its bathroom. 
Bed was comfortable. Balcony small but cozy. Sea view is the best thing about the room. We slept well at night, so there wasn't really much noise despite the hotel was facing the main road directly. Supermarket is at the back of the hotel, 3 minute walk. You can walk to many cafes on the road, and there is one just beneath the hotel. You can get a cab easily from there. 
There is free wifi, but speed was Nil. My smartphone connected to wifi but thats it, nothing. zero. I told the reception about it, he said they would reset the router. Next day, same problem.
There is free breakfast, but it is very very simple. The have a breakfast area. More like a breakfast room. A lady served me a plate that had 1 slice of luncheon, a slice of yellow cheddar cheese or roomi cheese, one boiled egg, sliced cucumber, sliced tomato, a couple of olives, one triangle of la vache qui rit, Jam and a bread basket and if you are lucky, mashed beans. You can request tea/coffee. The staff are friendly. The prices are cheap considering the location and view. It was around 42 US$ (310 EGP) per night. The room had a small tv with a receiver, which you probably wont use. It also a mini fridge that was empty, for your use as you please.No coffee or tea making facilities in the room. They do have someone to help you with the bags when you arrive. This kind of accommodation is good if you are staying 1 or 2 nights in Alexandria in my opinion.
reviews.title: Nice view and great location. The end.

photos.caption: the bathroom. hot water in room 306 does not last more than 15 mins

reviews.text: A delightfully ancient lift (but in good working order) up to the hotel.  A lovely reception area in the Old Colonial décor.  The rooms are "shabby chic", and none to well appointed (no bedside lights, a shower with its own agenda etc) but this place is absolutely delightful, and the staff are friendly and courteous too.  If you're not insisting on 5* luxury, this hotel is a must stay for the atmosphere.  We kept imagining that Poirot would step into the room at any time.
reviews.title: Old World Charm

reviews.text:
It is more like a pension than a hotel. We stayed there for 2 nights. One triple room.
Positive: sea- view, perfect location, friendly staff, cleaned rooms, WiFi, air condition.
Negative: pillow was really stiff, that it caused me severe neck pain in the morning & I had to take painkiller. 
Due to over-looking the sea, the noise was horrible, even late at night.
Small TV.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text:
We stayed here for just one night. The hotel is nice enough but expensive for what it is. 

The rooms were fine, comfortable beds and an ok bathroom. They were noisy but then given the location of the hotel we expected this and slept fine with earplugs.

The first problem was with the air con which was leaking water. Someone came to fix it and it was obviously a problem they had had before which makes me wonder why they didn't fix it before we arrived.

Breakfast was not very nice. The bread was ok but the salad and cheese with it seemed very dry and like it had been sat out for a while, the yogurt was past its date and didn't feel like it was kept in the fridge. A simple breakfast is ok but the food has to be fresh.

We asked to use the phone and were told that was fine and only after the call was finished were we told there was a 12LE charge. We would have happily paid if we had been told beforehand but it was cheeky to wait until after.

They were very nice about letting us leave our luggage with them while we were out for the day however we have subsequently noticed some money missing from one of the cases and can't think when it could have been taken. I'm not saying that they definitely stole it but perhaps a more secure lock than the three digit combination we had would be a good idea if you plan to leave luggage here/anywhere.

Overall it is an ok hotel with clean rooms in a good location however I would try somewhere different if I went back to Alexandria.
reviews.title: Alright hotel - good location and clean rooms

reviews.text:
About 1 1/2 months ago, my family and I went to Egypt to visit our friend in Alexandria. Since he didn't have enough room in his house for us, we stayed at this hotel instead. It is a VERY nice hotel with French architecture that has not been refurbished but in immaculate condition. The hotel itself is actually a floor in a building, but once you step in, you forget where you are. The view looks straight out onto the Mediterranean Ocean without any obstructions. It is located in a great place and many grocery stores and restaurants are nearby. 

If I ever comeback to Egypt again, this is the hotel I would stay at.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay in Alexandria

reviews.text:
It is more of a motel than a hotel.. rooms are clean, but small..still the value for money is very convenient.Staff are friendly.
Location is very good as it is in the center of Alexandria.A lot of shopping is around the hotel. It is very convenient if you are looking for a short stay of a night or two,but not that luxurious hotels.
reviews.title: Convenient for a short visit

reviews.text: The hotel is not for couples nor families, you can just go there if you are in a business trip or for only one night. There is only very poor breakfast and no launch or dinner. Staff are helpful and smiling. Beds were not clean and smelly. There was a group of guests together were very loud and noisy.
reviews.title: Very helpfull

reviews.text:
It's a good for an overnight stay but you have to lower your expectation.

It's an average hotel with an average AC and a poor internet coverage.

But it's a clean place and they have a decent room service.
reviews.title: Good for an overnight stay

reviews.text:
I had to attend a wedding at alex and all i was searching for a place to stay over night at yet to be clean and cozy. I searched a lot and chose green plaza inn.
It was above my expectations; clean, friendly staff and new furniture. I would definetly recommend it for any one looking for aaffordable clean accomodation and doesnt mind having no view
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay at for short stays.

reviews.text: Miss Mona's Is a waitress at the restaurant where I eat lunch on the daily basis, during my stay at the green Plaza Hotel. Mona, always went out of her way to provide a great service. I wish I could say the same for some of the man who waited on me during my stay at the hotel.
reviews.title: Lunch service

reviews.text: We enjoyed our day last night special thank for the person who make the cake complement and the decoration was very amazing.the place was quite and clean the service was good and the breakfast was excellent and high quality
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: I have been living in the hotel since July 2016. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. especially Mr. Yosry El-Samak, Moaz Al-Sabagh, Chef Abdul Salam and Sherif Azam. The hotel is located in Green Plaza where you can enjoy your shopping and dinning in many restaurants. The hotel has nice amenities including large swimming pools, play courts, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent Accomdation

reviews.text:
- Nice Hotel.
- Not expensive.
- Inside Green Plaza area which is great.
- No meals, only breakfast with low varieties.
- Rooms are clean.
- Staff is friendly and ready to help.
- you can order a delivery direct to your room.
reviews.title: Good value for money

name: San Giovanni Hotel
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.
address: 205 El Gueish Avenue Stanly Bay, Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text: I spent few days at this charming hotel in September 2022. I loved everything about my stay. The hotel staff, specially Marianne is very friendly and helpful. I was amazed by the service, the cleanliness, the location and the view. Breakfast was delicious and good variety. Sitting on the terrace over the Stanley beach was breathtaking. I highly recommend this gem of a hotel and I am already reserving there for my next trip at the end of June and july.
reviews.title: This hotel is a gem

reviews.text: Comfortable, beautiful view and very friendly staff. Bathrooms also fully equipped and in a great location in front of the sea. We had initially booked a standard room but the reception was nice enough to upgrade us to a suite for no extra charge! Breakfast was also amazing and included, with wide variety of options. Highly recommended, especially as you can get to all touristic places with uber for very low price, so much better than staying in the centre.
reviews.title: Amazing in all aspects!!

reviews.text:
The hotel is extremely beautiful, a lovely cozy place to stay on Stanley bridge in Alexandria corniche where you will see the prettiest and most calming view of the bridge and the sea together, we booked a sea view suite through the hotel staff and they gave us an amazing price , when arrived all staf where very welcoming with a warm smile and escorted us to out suite which was extremely clean well equipped and furnished. They offered us free wifi as well which was  great. Room was cleaned well every day and I highly recommend to get breakfast with your reservation for they have a lovely breakfast restaurant with a breathtaking sea view and delicious food, restaurant staff ate so friendly and cooperative. I would like to express my Gratitude to hotel staff for making my stay such a pleasure especially Ms. Marianne from the front desk and Ms. Farha from the housekeeping who went above and beyond to make our stay as perfect.
This hotel is the place to stay if you Want to enjoy Alexandria and im very glas i had the chance to stay in such a beautiful historical hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel and staff

reviews.text:
Accepted and good hospitality 
Suit 105 with balacon, amazing room with perfect view.
A little classic and old place but comfortable 
Need more action on night activities and clubs 
Food is moderate, pizza was good
reviews.title: Good

reviews.text:
Food was great. The field au championnat is not as good as last year but it’s still great. 
The chicken soup was good. The wine is not bad, last year was better. The lady salad is amazing. The lasagna is great. The mixed grill was cold. Service is usually excellent, This time was not like last year. Not as usual but still a nice experience
reviews.title: Last year vs this year

reviews.text:
One of the most enjoyable stays in Alexandria in that stylish and vintage hotel with its cozy rooms and super excellent service and outstanding customer experience and goes without saying the excellent location.
I would recommend it for other travellers.
reviews.title: Best Customer Experience

reviews.text: The worst hotel i have been too. Starting from the night shift receptionist very unprofessional. Our room wasn’t ready. We are couple he gave us narrow room . Very bad one  not like the one i booked in booking.com not enough for 1 big luggage . Smelly bathroom. Rude staff. I do not recommend this hotel yo anyone
reviews.title: Horrible!

reviews.text:
Do not stay at this hotel. The hotel management has absolutely no idea what good customer service means. Here are a few examples.
1. I asked for a quiet room before we checked in. But we were given a room near the staff room and someone was rattling around round the clock. The staff is walking down the hall, slamming the door, talking, and watching videos on the phone. And all this at NIGHT. Some stuff guy told me "can't do anything, if you don't like it - change the room". Manager at the reception to all my complaints promised to fix it, but did nothing.
    2. There was no hot water. Just after few complaints they fixed it, but still, water was barely warm. 
    3.Rooms look older than the picture.
    4.In the bathroom constantly accumulates water on the floor and does not come out through the hole
    5.Very slow internet.
reviews.title: Terrible place

reviews.text:
My Husband and I stay one night 28th October - 24th October 2020.

Actually we wish to stay in Tolip Hotel Or Stegenberger, Ended up we stop to try San Giovanni Hotel.

Hotel room was  little fine, But Double bed room it was very small only  enough for 1 person sleep, 
My husband and I Need to sequeezing each other. Aicond was noise whole the night, Our room was faced Bridge and Sea,  which were if went out that was nice has balcony and can sea view but have to shared balcony with other guest... 

Unfortunate because our room front of bridge so the noise whole the day from traffic outside..

Locker was not worked.. 

Breakfast it was very simple, 1 omelette , 3 pieces smaller of Falafel, Coffee , cheese, yogurt , Aish ( Local bread)  

Staffs was Friendly and try to helful it was nice however Staff wasn't wear mask.

Price for the Rooom with Taxes Expensive.  with such a condition room like that.
reviews.title: Small & Old  Hotel, Small Double Bed

reviews.text:
Location is very good and staff are friendly m. r Hassan in lobby bar &m. r shady in restaurant is good and friendly i love this place and service is very nice.
 I will send my friends to come to this place
reviews.title: Sun rise

reviews.text: We've been coming to this hotel for ages because of its unique location and it was always OK but we used to have the occasional problem with the staff. There's obviously been a dramatic change in management because now they really understand the concept of hospitality. Friendly, smiling, eager to please and professional staff throughout the hotel. Great food. Really well done San Giovanni. We will never stay anywhere else in Alexandria
reviews.title: Great value and location

reviews.text: Lovely hotel with a wonderful view! The hotel upgraded us to a suite as a complimentary gesture with a small terrace and an excellent view to the sea.  The room is cosy and so comfy. The breakfast was lovely and the restaurant is directly by the sea with a warm ambiance. I highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Authentic & vintage hotel

reviews.text: The room was very clean and tide but we have found cockroach dead next to the wardrobe ....the restaurant was very delicious.....the staff was very polite to us....you can have breakfast next to the sea view
reviews.title: 3 star

reviews.text:
We stayed at the San Giovanni for five nights in March. It was built in 1950 and has a lot of character.The rooms have been updated and are very clean and modern. Our friends had a lovely suite with a walk- out balcony.
This hotel is next to the famous and pretty Stanley bridge. 
The breakfast is included in the room price. It has a large selection of American and Arabic food. You can sit inside the breakfast restaurant or go outside on the patio with a view of the bridge and water. 
The staff was very accomodating and friendly. The hotel is located in a good area and in the tourist area.
reviews.title: Hotel with character and a view of the Mediterranean

name: Alexandria Mediterranean Suites

reviews.text: Very nice place the hotel is quite and comfortable the rooms is very clean the staff is friendly the breakfast is fresh and also served to the rooms ,near to the beach and corniche of Alexandria near also to Montaza palace

reviews.text: It's 2 stars hotel nice location good staff it was good experience the receptionist was nice Mr.mohamed sibhi hotel manger Mr.Raffat was nice man. With nice smile location in mandarra near everything .
reviews.title: 2stars suite

reviews.text: I made a booking through Bookings.com for 2 separate rooms at a certain rate per night. The website confirmed my booking, then i arrived at the hotel about an hour later. We told the receptionist about our booking and that we would like to check the rooms before we stay. The guy took me and my female friend upstairs and showed us a Suite and he told us that our booking is for one room inside this Suite!!! And that we can choose either a single bed or double room!.. We objected this strongly and told him there must be a mistake we are not married and w booked two rooms and had a confirmation. He took us downstairs again and then there was another guy "duty manager apparently" who asked us if we are married or not and when are we checking out! We told him we are not married and we made a booking for 2 separate rooms he kept repeating his questions in a weird way and claimed that there has been an error om Bookings.com website and that they only have a request for one room, in case we need another room we will habe to pay triple the amout!!!!! Although he had a printed form paper from their system which had my name and my friends name and our info. Which proves that they have received the request. The guy kept playing with his words and manipulating us and asking us stupid questions. He said to me you can't stay here because you are Egyptian if you had any other nationality we would have tried to help you!. I've never been treated in such a shameful way. They are liars although they have good ratings on booking.com but rest assured that there's something unclear and not straight about this so called hotel!
reviews.title: Swindlers and

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Alexandria Mediterranean Suites. I was surprised at the great view of the Mediterranean Sea that I had from my suite. It was fantastic! The suite itself was larger than I had expected, which I appreciated, & had a lot of Old World charm. There was even a proper refrigerator where I could store my snacks & bottles of water. Fortunately, the a/c worked very well & I always slept comfortably. The owner Raafat lives on sight & is always available to help guests with whatever they need.

reviews.text:

Furniture is average, location is close to the beach of Mandara, some of the apartments overlooking the sea especially those in high floors.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Mediterranean Suites in January, after a three week holiday travelling around Egypt. The suite was clean and well appointed, with ocean views and breezes. Our tariff was exactly as quoted. Raafat and his staff were great in providing us with helpful hints for travelling around the region and ensuring we were not ripped off by unscrupulous locals. He was a sincere and genuine host, with happy staff, and if I return to Alexandria I will definitely be booking into to the Alexandria Mediterranean!

photos.caption: We do like it so much and good value of money for this apartment

reviews.text: My friends and I booked a suite using Booking.com for a night at this hotel because we were planning to see the historical city of Alexandria. We somehow had a hard time looking for the hotel at first because it was located in one of the small alleys facing the corniche. However, Mr. Rafaat from the reception was kind enough to talk to our egyptian driver to guide us on our way to the hotel. We were so tired from the less than 4 hrs trip. When we arrived at the lobby, Mr. Raafat suggested that we should get 2 suites, one for men and the other for women because we were accompanied by our egyptian driver. This is a common law in Egypt. We were hesutant at first but he gave us a discount for the second suite. We paid a total of 130 dollars for the 2 suites for 1 night. We found the suites very nice. The girls picked up the suite with a nice view of the Mediterranean sea. The girls' suite consists of one master's bedroom with a bathroom and another bedroom with 2 beds. There's a big bathroom outside. A kitchen with a sink and utensils and a refrigerator, which we think was not functioning properly. We had a nice television and a dining table. Everything is complete. The boys' suite, I think, comes with more bed and more rooms, I didn't had time to check on it though. The downside is that there is a school located beside the hotel so you will hear lots of children screaming during the morning when school starts. We had generally a good experience with this hotel.
reviews.title: Unexpected sophistication on one of Alexandria's small alleys

reviews.text: I spent end of February in Alexandria City , Alexandria Mediterranean Suites is comfortable living place, friendly stuff , always helpfull , I enjoyed my time here,  Thanks to Mr. Raafat and his stuff, thank you so much
reviews.title: Alexandria Mediterranean Suites, wonderfull time to live

reviews.text: It was a nice stay i felt like home there the rooms was spacious and very comfy fully equipped from rooms to kitchens , th ecleanliness is on point the house keeping staff were so helpful and the staff in general were so friendly and like a seconed home to me i really hope to come back soon .
