reviews.text: I spend two nights in August. The suite was nice and very clean. The personnel was friendly and helpful. My suite had a partial view to the sea but the rest as my son described was "view under construction" (a lot of buildings next to it). The reason I left was that there was no generator and due to the power blackouts at Alexandria we had to walk up and down 12 flours. The manager informed me that in the next 1-2 months they would install one.

reviews.text: the suite was so clean and comfortable for a family to stay. the staff were very friendly and efficient. the beach just across the street and the room had a wonderful sunset over the sea view from the balcony. we were very happy during our stay and we will go there again on our next stay in beautiful alexandria

reviews.text:
Night shift team were working like a robots, as they wanted to let me pay for the parking fees while I'm picking up friend and once I went to the reception I found 2 people and one of them inside the reception counter his name is Marwan and another person who is standing outside the reception counter wearing a blue suit **it seems security **smoking at the reception with the full smell of smoke and that was my first Shock!!! I haven’t seen an employee dealing with a customer while he is smoking in the Lobby!!!! 

I explained to the receptionist that I was with my friend and I’m the one who is taking care of him and we choose the hotel even though it’s a bit expensive to have flexibility, however the receptionist answered me that the **facility only for the guest not for you**… I never argued back and I paid the money knowing that I have to deal only with Evening shift team to avoid a such mess and it seems night shift team mixing between trouble maker guests and me and my guest because in fact my guest is still had the rights as he doesn’t have a car because he is from Oman and I’m the one who is dropping him and picking him up so it was not a valid answer for me coz it means I have to pay every time I’m coming for pickup or drop off  ** it’s a hassle for my guest who is staying at your hotel**

From my experience being working in the hotel industry for more than 15 years in different hotels chain **Accor hotels – Minor hotels – Hilton hotels**  Night shift is the decision maker and he should have shown bit of flexibility rather than focusing on rules and policy without using a common sense in a such case
reviews.title: Bad experience **Reception staff** Night shift team

reviews.text:
The hotel is located in a very nice place close to Tivoli Dome where all the nice cafes and restaurants are located .. rooms are wide and clean .. the view is fabulous as the hotel is beachfront even sea side view is very nice

I was there for a business meeting, and for that it is clearly below standards: WiFi not accessible outside of rooms, even not in lobby or hotel; little dust but far from clean at multiple aspects (bathroom with easily removable stains on the tiles; shower in the corners; garbage bin, and so on. Noisy airconditioning. Amenities in the room that require reparation/renewal. Annoying (fire?) alarm that I needed every evening to ask to shut off as close to my room; warn-out matras of the bed; ...
However, breakfast more than sufficient in variation, quantity and quality, and the amenities for a family holiday seem good. Water cooker in the room, with sufficient and filled-up Nescafe but only glasses and no cups; empty frigerator, so why having it?

reviews.text:
The hotel is a best example of having a great facility that is all ruined by bad management and low quality service 
Pros:
Great location, good modern room with needed amenities & sea breeze at night is to die for
Cons:
They r plenty but will list the most impacting which ruined our vacation.  Food quality is the worst i have seen in the many many Egyptian hotels i have tried, overpriced drinks on the pool and all around with discrimination in prices between civilians and militants which is weird for a hotel opened for tourism, internet connection reminded me of the 90s , unclear rules regarding utilising swimming pools which ruined our first day as we had to purchase  hair caps for the girls which wasn't stated during booking so we can bring before coming to the hotel , management weren't able to handle the problems professionally as per tourism standards,  there is a big gap between running a hotel through a professional in hotels/ tourism Vs the management of this hotel who comes from an unrelated background totally 

Don't recommend at all and definitely to avoid even if cheaper comapred to other proper hotels from well known chains

name: Triomphe Hotel
address: 26 El Gorfa El Togaria St.- Ramlah Station, Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text:
Triomphe Hostel is very central, there are alot of shopping, markets, restaurants and very near to corniche. You can take minibuses to go Library and corniche route. Hostel is at 5th floor of apartment. Its elevator very old and classic. Its good to ride this kind of elevator and fantastic. Checkin is fast. Rooms clean, bathroom is good and ac is very good and silent, beds and pillow cosy, spacement enough. 
There are some rooms which doesnt have ac. Only con this hostel there is no brekfast service. In my opinion they should think about twice, to start day with breakfast is very good it might be basic or continental or extra charge. Hotel staff is also good and helpful. Overall is good
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text:
Stayed there last weekend for a night. I called only hours before arriving and was given the choice for a room with shared bathroom (300 EGP) or a private bathroom (450). I went for the latter. The room had a balcony with (side-) view of the Mediterranean Sea, was clean and had 3 single beds. What else can you expect?
The hotel is on the 5th floor of an old building, connecting 5 apartments. Staff is super nice and helpful.
reviews.title: A stealth with super staff

reviews.text:
Booking was very straightforward online. The hotel is on the 5th floor of the building and travel from street level to the hotel reception is via an antiquated lift complete with exterior metal doors and then interior wooden doors. Close all the doors and the lift works every time! Our room was a large spacious twin room with a balcony on 3 sides, overlooking the street on 2 sides, and glimpses down a side street to the Mediterranean sea. TV and fridge were welcome extras. The ensuite bathroom facilities were reasonably clean and spacious.  Lots of street noise but it was surprising how quickly we became immune to the noise! Great location one block back from the sea.
Pleasant lounge area in the lobby area also with a TV. Wifi is very erratic but eventually works.
Reception staff were very helpful and obliging and arranged a car for a day trip to El Alamein (LE 800).  We would definitely recommend the Triomphe Hotel as a good value 2 – 3 star hotel.
reviews.title: Good Value 3 star hotel in downtown Alexandria

reviews.text: The Triomphe Hotel is a budget class, but exceeds that title in many ways.  I took the train there from Cairo for a 3-day stay, and was very pleasantly surprised at what my hotel offered.  I had a corner room on the top floor, with windows looking East and South, and a view of the Mediterranean Sea just a half block to the north.  I found the staff to be friendly and helpful, the old time elevator was a turn-of-the-century delight, and I loved spending down time in both my room and the lobby area (where WiFi was best).  I travel often to foreign destination, and would rate this bargain hotel in the top 20% of places that I have been in the last 5 years.  It is also in the heart of the city, and only a few blocks from what turned out to be my favorite bar -- the Spitfire (highly recommended, for socializing and listening to classic rock music).  I loved the city, and this hotel was part of that excellence.
reviews.title: Classic hotel with much to offer!

reviews.text:
We were in a residential area in Al Amriya but decided to be in the city after our trip in Cairo. After checking the lists of hotels in the centre of Alexandria we decided to choose Triomphe Hotel.

The beds are neatly arranged and as the weather is very friendly the room balcony is the best place to sit and talk with your companions. The guests areas are well arranged to sit and read/watch tv programs.

The hotel staff are very supportive though they have aged differently and will definitely stay again in Triomphe once I'm back in Alexandria.

Thank you
reviews.title: My return to Alexandria-Egypt

reviews.text:
Even though the hotel is not bad I didn't like at all the treat from the stuff. The price they told me on the phone wasn't the one they gave me at the location, and I had to pay more for a room with no bathroom and double bed (what I was supposed to be paying). They told us we could us the gym downstairs for free and then we had to pay for it when we were done. 
I tried to talk politely with the old man, but he was very rude with me all the time. 
The hotel has this old environment which is nice to see and experience, but is not very clean and the beds are not comfortable. 
The location is very good. 
I would basically not recommend this place because of the stuff. When it comes to work with tourism, one is supposed to be helpful and polite.
reviews.title: Don't recommend it

reviews.text:
As the place is old, management style was a bit outdated too. But still a good authentic experience.

Terms of stay shouldn't be different onsite and online. Book and extend any reservations online.

In general location was excellent you'll love the classic Alexandria feel if you're into that stuff. FYI you'll adore the elevator, it's such a jem from the past.

Overall you'll have a great time and have access to many restaurants, bars and transportation. Also just a minute away from the beach 🏖
reviews.title: A really authentic classic place with history 🇪🇬

reviews.text: During a brief trip up to Alexandria from Cairo I stayed in Triomphe Hotel. For the most part my stay was nice, the nighttime staff helped me to learn Arabic and the location is brilliant, right on the coast. But I must tell the story of my last day... check out is at 12, I'm a late sleep so I usually leave it until near check out time to leave, however at 11:15 I get a knock at the door and I'm told off by an elderly man (who I assumed was the owner) telling me to get out already, quite shocked I started to pack, shower etc, he banging my door in the shower! Say at about 11:30 and then 11:45 bang my door room again telling me it's very late and I should leave. Despite check out being 12pm noon I have no idea why he was so rude and scoffed at me as I handed in the key a few minutes before 12. I've been travelling for 10+ years and I've never encouraged such rude service anywhere, ever! Just had to tell my story. If you do stay, I just hope you don't get this super rude, grumpy old man.
reviews.title: A rude awakening

reviews.text:
It's good trial to stay there
# clean rooms
# respectable staff and specially Mr. Ahmed
# so good for low budget owners and rent rates so good
# so prime location in old Alex. And not need to move by car
reviews.title: Good

reviews.text: This is not a fancy hotel but has character and a convenient location.  There are rooms with a private bathroom and with a shared bathroom.  There are also rooms on the outside with balconies which have a water view when you step outside and look right, and interior rooms which can be quite dark but very good for sleeping.  If you have an inside room you can also relax in the common room with a balcony and get the best of both worlds.  Beds were comfortable and staff friendly.
reviews.title: Good location, clean and pleasant

reviews.text:
I’m a frequent traveler. I’ve been to hostels all around the world, and my friends know me for being very picky and critical. Having said that; 
1: I was met soon arrival by Amr, the hotel proprietor who was super friendly and decent. He showed me several different rooms and let me choose. 
2: The room I chose had a 2 beds, a sink, a functioning TV, table and 2 chairs, a balcony with a side sea view, etc. Everything in the room was functioning well; lights, TV, etc. 
3: Everything was extremely clean. Bed sheets, pillows, sink, wardrobe, light switches, etc. I have bronchial asthma and am allergic to the slightest dust. There wasn’t any. Even under the beds. 
4: I had access to a shared bathroom that was extremely clean, and I witnessed it cleaned again every couple of hours by a janitor. I was given a clean towel, lots of toilet paper rolls, a soap, shampoo, and shower gel. 
5: I had access to a simple basic kitchen that was functioning and clean. 
6: The hotel was peaceful. 
7: Prime location for me as I like to be close to the center hub, and prefer walking. 

All in all, it was a very satisfying experience and I have recommended it to friends. 
Extremely good value for my money at 10 $ a night, which I paid in local currency. 

All in all, if you’re looking for a clean, safe, comfortable place to stay with a great location, and are traveling on a budget, this place is for you. 
But if you’re looking for some fancy hotel, this isn’t for you.
reviews.title: Much more than I expected

reviews.text: The Triomphe Hotel in Alexandria is a wonderful place to stay. We went there as a fellow traveller was going there and we had read about this great hotel in the Lonely Planet. The hotel is on the 6th floor of a 130-year-old building very close to the Sea. Our room had a side view from our balcony.  The proprietors, the father Alex in the evening and his son, also Alex, in the day, speak great English, are very friendly, helpful, and are always at the front desk so security is not an issue.  The rooms are very spacious with 10ft ceilings, as are the doors to the balcony.  Our room had 2 single beds and a sink.  The shared bathroom was clean, and had warm showers.  The Triomphe Hotel is a 5-minute walk to the Coniche (the main street along the water front), and is approximately half way between the library and Fort Qaitbey.  The Mohammed Ahmed restaurant (also in the Lonley Planet), is always full of locals, is nearby and is a fabulous, inexpensive place to eat. The Triomphe was a very good for place to stay for the price.
reviews.title: Loved the people at the desk

reviews.text: The hotel is very nice and the staff at the top of respect and special thanks to the master do not know his name but he is an older person who received me and made a reservation to me I have a problem which I suffered from the Internet is very weak, please solve this problem
reviews.title: Good

reviews.text: I stayed in this motel for 2 nights in an air conditioned room. The place is not fancy, it is modest. The people at the reception are so helpful and friendly. The place is a good place for just spending the night to sleep while you are outside all the day as there is nothing to do in it.
reviews.title: Good Place

reviews.text: I came across this place in a travel book, and I wish I hadn't. On the surface, it seemed like a fine place, but once I was settled, I realized that there was no toilet paper, no towel, no shower curtain, no hot water, and the mini shampoo bottle was half used. It was made worse by the fact that based on the booking, I was supposed to pay in local currency, but the manager insisted I pay in US dollars. I didn't have dollars, so he tried to force me to pay at a higher exchange rate. When I showed him the email saying that I was supposed to pay in local currency, he still didn't relent. It was the worst hotel experience I had traveling throughout Egypt. Don't stay here--there's too many other options to waste time at Triomphe.
reviews.title: Avoid, avoid, avoid

reviews.title: Never coming here again

reviews.text:
Stayed for 4 days.

The room was on the 1st floor where the reception is. Large spotlessly clean room. Very quite AC. Small washroom, but clean with all necessary toileteries provided.

A 10 minute walk to the cornich. The hotel entrance is located opposite the main gate of a school, between two trees. The reception is on the first floor. Free wifi at the reception. Did not have any breakfast.

Now the negative. I got a room directly facing the school.  They play soccer everynight and the fullblown shouting and screaming goes on till late into the night. On a Friday, went on till 1 a.m. Today is Sunday and I am writting this review at 11.40 p.m and the shouting and screeming is still going on. God knows what time I can go to bed.

Hence please avoid getting a room facing the school.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel with some Negatives

reviews.text:
This place reminds me of a parisienne hotel. Small clean entrance and up a level of stairs to the reception.
Hubby and I stayed for 3 nights.
The place is spotless, low key and traveler friendly... the ritz it's not... but we'd hate that.
The central location saved us loads of Uber costs and the large pre- plated breakfast saved us having to spend on lunch and wait for a great dinner.... classic travelers ploys.
Rooms 104, 105, 204, 205 have  medium sized rooms, large balconies big beds, interesting but clean bathrooms and it looks like most of the ACs are nearly new. The views of St Catherine's and the courtyard are quiet and brain cooling, letting you decompress from the maelstrom of Alexandria.
reviews.title: Central, really clean, hospitable staff large pre plated breakfast.. what more do you want?

reviews.text:
I accommodated at Extenstion building not in a main building, it was a very new furniture executive floor. 

It was a one night only I came Alex as a business overnight but it was so nice accommodation. 

The view was very nice church view and side sea view from 13 floor !! 

Thank you for receptionist and the nice person whose assist me to the extension building and show me two suites  to choose one
reviews.title: I was looking for a good and quiet hotel near by old area

reviews.text:
I booked one bed room apartement through booking the price was very nice according to the facillities 
- It was at 16th floor ,
- It has small kitchenette with microwave , kettle & small fridge 
- It has dinning table , one king bed , 2 queen beds , wardrobe & 2 couches
- it has flat tv , air conditioner (cool & heat ) & free wifi 
- they dont have parking but they help u 2 park infront of the building 
- some of the rooms are renovated 

I dislike one thing ( they dont have dont disturb signs so when w had a problem with the tv they entered the room with the technical while we were out without taking any permission & they shocked when we come back and found them at the room )  

Overall i enjoyed my stay it was cozy , clean , tidy , the stuff was very helpful & for sure i’ll repeat it 👍🏻
reviews.title: Nice stay ( will recommend it )

reviews.text:
The hotel is located inside a residential/office building and it’s right across a school. The location is not bad, you’re about 20 mins walk from beach/central station. There are some churches around but other than that not much as it’s located in a back street.

I got a free upgrade to a bigger room - very spacious but really old furniture. The bathroom had one of the sliding doors missing in the shower, rooms are cleaned everyday but on my last day there were no towels for some reason. Also the hot water runs out after like 5 mins.

Overall not a bad experience but would stay elsewhere next time.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.text:
The hotel is mid-ranged hotel. Its cost is very much affordable and budget friendly, I paid 3000 EGP for three nights in high season. 
The staff are helpful, and they offer a good level of service and cleanliness, needless to say excellent location.
It's not a luxury destination for those looking for luxury, yet I liked my stay there and would recommend it.
reviews.title: Good Choice (Would Recommend It)

reviews.text: I went in the building that the hotel were inside, first problem the entrance were dirty and i didn't know the hotel is. The elevator was half broken and very small so i toke the stairs to find the hotel. The hotel was in the first floor and the entrance was as an apartment door. When we went in our room the room was smelly and dirty. Don't recommend the hotel
reviews.title: Dirty entrance and smelly rooms

reviews.text: Steigenberger Cecil Hotel in Alexandria is in a great location on the Corniche. Some rooms have views of the Mediterranean. The lift is an old school open metal gate system. Rooms were reasonable. There are restaurants close by eg the Delices and there is an alcohol outlet behind the hotel called Drinkies. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great old world experience

reviews.text: Ok so I know I was booking a budget hotel and the rooms were well maintained, clean and tidy. The furniture was old and worn but functional and the bed was compfrtable. The door locks were impossible and we even had to accompany of of the other travelers to her room to help her get in. We were in "The other bulding" which is fine. We booked 3 x suites each to bed 4 people. We wanted the extra room of the suites and were happy to pay the price. On arrival we completed  3 guests forms and then when we were taken to the rooms, the porter told us only 2 rooms, 2 people in each. we had to object and we settled the 2 single ladies in their room. That left us 2 single males who were to share a room. The porter finally relented and took us to a suite which contained only a double bed. they basically told us thats all we were getting so we just put up with it. The hallways were covered with dust n dirt and hadent been cleaned or dusted in years which wasnt a problem as the rooms were clean. The picture I attached does not exist even tho its the main pic used on both Agoda nad Booking.com,  I think its part of one of the nearby churches so feel a bit deceived on the style of property.
reviews.title: Worse than expected

reviews.text: Clean, cosy, very spacious and nicely decorated. My flat (501 on the 5th floor) had one bedroom, an open kitchen, a dining area and a small living room. They all have access to their own balcony and terraces. I liked the view, the free Wi-Fi connection and the location (in the heart of the old city). Very good value for money, for sure!
reviews.title: Great value for money!

reviews.text:
A superb choice in the heart of downtown in a good location for visiting nearby sites and restaurants. Large room was spotlessly clean, with tiled floor, fresh new towels, comfortable beds and decent bathroom. The porters were magic with our big bags.
Thanks for the vote if you found this review helpful.
reviews.title: Perfect family room at reasonable price

reviews.text: Not recommended at all.1st,its not the room that we booked and the manager didny explained to me well before i pay the money.2nd,they put us in 1st floor that we hear all the noise cant even sleep well.3rd,there is no privacy at all they put us in a place beside the reception itself and camera was on our room we are like criminals.this really worse experience. We suppose to stay for 2 nights but we change our mind because of this and the staffs not good at all.we will not coming back.
reviews.title: Worse experience

reviews.text:
They are just using a dublex flat as a hotel and some flat in other resdintual building near to them with the same rates of a hotel 
There way was soo rude 
I agreed to take a room for one day as i was just married and having one day before going for my honeymoon with my wife but we still did not get the official paper so we just had a stamped paper from the authorized person which is supposed that all hotels know this paper 
The manager dealed with me as i am faking it with a very bad look, 
I dont know how my would have felt if she was there and saw what happened
That is not even a hotel 
Really don’t rent from them there is much more good and professional hotels in alexandria
reviews.title: Non professional rudness

name: The Grand Plaza Hotel Smouha
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.
address: 14th May Avenue Smouha, Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text:
The hotel has a central location in Smouha with everything you need in a walking distance .
Check in was pretty fast. The rooms are spacious, classic style. They pay special attention to pleasing your sense of smell. My room had a very nice oriental smell like oud or wood-like fragrance but not offensive. The shower kit had gummy smell that was satisfying too. I did get quality sleep which was really essential in such a short trip with no much time to be waisted sleeping but I woke up well rested due to the mattress with just right firmness. The room was quiet despite the vital location which is hard to find most of the times. 
WiFi was provided for free in the room with good speed that you can stream YouTube or manage some work on the go. 
Breakfast was tasty and I highly recommend trying the grilled vegetables.
Hotel team were very hospitable and helpful.
Overall, the hotel offers good value for your hard earned money.
reviews.title: Great Value for Money

owner_response.text:
Dear Ms Yasmine,
It is our real pleasure and gratitude to receive positive comments from a very important guest like yourself, I am so happy and proud that we succeeded to meet your expectations and we managed to make your recent stay as enjoyable as ever.
It is a pleasure to see that in general you were happy with the services you received during your stay with us. 
 we aim to improve the level of services that our guests receive, and in today’s world this is essential.
Once again, I would like to thank you for the time spent to write to us and we really are looking forward to seeing and welcoming you back again to your second home.
Best Regards,
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
A very good hotel with a good service, all process as easy also staff are improving every time I stay there. 

Rooms are big and clean, I would recommend this hotel as a very good value for money. 

I would stay there another time while in Alexandria for sure
reviews.title: Value for Money

reviews.text:
Ok rooms. Bathroom soso.  Breakfast spread was limited but quality was good

Located in very congested area. Lots of traffics around. No views from room. 

Wifi issues. Coffee shop rather sad
 
Staff was courteous. 

General opinion was average. Avoid if one can.
reviews.title: Quick stay at Alex

reviews.text: Very nice and clean hotel.  Staff is very polite and helpful rooms are comfortable and clean. Price is good. Hotel is located in the middle of Alexandria you can easily go everywhere. Shops and green plaza mole is near by.  I recommend it
reviews.title: A very nice and clean hotel

reviews.text:
Very good hotel
delicious lunch just need more variety 
Breakfast is delicious 
Rooms are clean
Staff are friendly 
Check in was fast 
Cafe area is nice 
They need to provide a bottle of water every day not per stay 
the only problem is the room view.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in Grand Plaza hotel for 3 weeks, our time there was very comfortable, the food was outstanding, everyone was warm and friendly and very polite. I am recommending this hotel to all of my friends and family whenever they visit Alexandria.
reviews.title: Efficient and friendly staff

reviews.text: Unfriendly and unprofessional staff. Hotel is very noisy. Guests are smoking everywhere the smell even goes to the the inside of your room. You complained about the noise and smell 3 times and they did nothing. It is impossible to sleep comfortably. Guests are treated badly from staff. Never going to this hotel again.
reviews.title: Bad hotel never stay there

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is average due to no view of the hotel on the sea or the swimming pool. The rooms are good, the cleanliness is good. There were some problems in the room, such as air conditioning and the phone, and they were resolved quickly, and this is a good thing in dealing with the problem quickly. The best thing about the hotel is that it is in the city center and the disadvantage is that it does not have a swimming pool  Or its own beach and few activities inside the hotel
reviews.title: Good for a short stay for business

reviews.text:
The hotel has very good location, the staff are nice.
They have upgraded my room for free and the check in was very fast.
The food was good and have variety in the breakfast. The city view is not attractive 
The only thing I didn’t like is the parking fee. It’s expensive.
reviews.title: Very good value to money

reviews.text:
Hotel is very noisy unclean uncomfortable staff are not professional, I complained twice and they apologise and promised to compensate me to get our satisfaction but nothing happened. 
I am not recommended this hotel.
Dust at room ,human hair in room , cigarette ash in bathroom, ice in fridge, no door lock.
reviews.title: Very bad

reviews.text: Nice and professional hotel, providing extra high quality of service and makes you enjoy loveable accommodation, highly recommended for all types of stay, however it's somehow away from the beautiful Alexandria's Cornish.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text:
We visited Alexandria for 1 day and stayed here  after arriving from. Cairo and local sightseeing.

There is lots of construction going on  near the highway and takes a long time to arrive .

Thank god we were with the car and driver  and guide.

Check in was very smooth and easy .

Rooms were excellent.

Refrigerator,  bottled water  provided in the room 

Air conditioning was  good .

Very close to the shopping mall. There are lots of choice for the food there including chinese, Egyptian etc .

We did not eat dinner  Buffett in the hotel called. Venus. Restaurant . Instead we ordered from the menu .
That was an excellent decision.
We being vegetarians there was not too much choice .

Mr HAITHAM  MOHAMED  assistant restaurant manager came to our help. We requested him what we wanted to eat and he went over and beyond to make sure food was cooked to  the perfection.
We ate lentil soup piping hot, we requested to make BABA GANOUSH hot and add some green chilies for flavor ,and mix vegetables ( carrot, zucchini etc )with spices  with a touch of turmeric. He went inside the kitchen to make sure it was cooked properly . We had this with bread and rice .
He mad our evening a memorable one .

Thank you. Mr. Haitham 

Breakfast was included with room  charge .

Though selection was plenty with one of the best falafel balls cooked to the perfection few things were certainly missing for this high end hotel 

There was live omelet station 

There was no freshly baked quality bread,  though there were lots of  other bread ,no toaster ,  melon cut was raw and not riped, oranges cut were too poor quality .

I DID BRING THIS TO THE ATTENTION OF THE  RESTAURANT MANAGER WHO MET ME NEAR FRUITS SELECTION AND ASKED ME HOW IS EVERYTHING?.

May be I was expecting too much .
reviews.title: LOOK NO FURTHER

owner_response.text:
Dear Our Valued Guest, 

     I would like to thank you for taking the time to submit a review concerning your recent experience at Grand Plaza Somuah Hotel and sharing your comment at our hotel  page.

We are so happy with all what you have mentioned and will certainly pass it to our team members who will be proud and excel more efforts for service excellence.

Looking forward to welcoming you back at your soonest for another memorable stay at our hotel.

Sincerely,

Mohamed Saady
Hotel Manager

reviews.text: Location is good, breakfast is very basic needs much improvement in terms of variety and quality. Air condition was working only on fan mode, and I requested to operate it on cool mode they replied it's a central  AC and we're not in summer yet!
reviews.title: Not a good experience

reviews.text: Arrived at 3pm  shown to a room that was not allocated to me . Finally given a room on the 12 floor 1206. Continuous buzzing noise. Traffic sounds like I'm on the street and the bed and pillows are like stone . No double glazing. At 23.05 the telephone rings to ask if I need anything after telling them no it continues to  ring 3 more times then to cap it all having a do not disturb sign on my door I was woke up at 1.05 in the morning asking would I like water. This place is not the hotel to stay at I unfortunately chose this horrible place and it was a big mistake
reviews.title: Worst hotel in Alexandria

reviews.text: The hotel is very dirty the service is very bad ..they never change seats by the 10 days we stay there …everu body was rude. The breakfast was a terrible buffet after 930 am they replace nothing ..:one of us need a doctor and they did not help us ..the elevator did not work …we ask about the manager and they come 4 different people …service very slow and very bad ..is the worst hotel I ever been in my life and I travel a lot ..:thru my opinion is one star hotel and not four stars hotel as they sell it ..
reviews.title: The worst hotel I ever been

reviews.text:
I was there unfortunately for 10 days in this hotel.The people was so unpolite  to me without any reason.The breakfast and genera the service was the worse I ever had in my life,after 9.30 the breakfast boufe was empty without the basic breakfast food like butter or cheese ….The room was very dirty,the bed sheets never change them in 10 days even if I was telling them every morning,the cloning lady was putting me conditioner instead of shampoo and the toilet floor was always dirty.
A friend of mine came to see me and they didn’t allow him even in the lobby to come and have a coffee with me and they was very impolite also to him. Never again …!!!!
reviews.title: 1 star hotel instead of 4 stars

reviews.text:
The hotel is wonderful, starting from its location, 
the view of the room overlooking the sea and the street, the cleanliness, the reception, the attention to the guest and the tranquility...

reviews.text: Unforgettable view all the staff with supportive especially Mr.Amr from the reception very friendly and ask about the stay daily give us early check-in and have his own style to handle the guest, we have faced issues as the food not allowed from out side but over all enjoyed the stay,
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

reviews.text:
Thanks for all staff members,  fast and friendly staff , room was clean, view was amazing, nice breakfast with high quality bakery, fast responding for our requests. 

Really we will be back as soon as we visit Alexandria. 

Highly recommended
reviews.title: Nice rooms,  great view & service

reviews.text:
I have visited a lot of hotels around Alexandria , honestly it's one the best hotels , well trained staff, room was well maintained with great view and clean.
Breakfast is nice.
Highly recommended , good value.
reviews.title:
Great service ,,
WoW view

reviews.text: This hotel has exceptional staff. They are friendly and willing to make your stay comfortable as much as you can. The view is amazing I had room 803, the location is very close to many attractions and public transportation. Parking is available for your private car at a nearby garage for 50 EGP/night. The breakfast is very good with lots of variety and yummy items. The Food court at San Stefano Mall is within walking distance of the hotel for more options. Other cafes and beaches are also very close to the hotel. The hotel is clean and follows a strict face-mask policy for staff. I highly recommend and I will be definitely staying again on my next visit to Alexandria.
reviews.title: Very Nice View and Excellent Location

reviews.text:
We enjoyed our stay, the room was satisfactory, food is delicious, staff were very friendly and welcoming, location is perfect and nearby all means of transportation, the view is one of the best you can find in Alex. 
Isolation for traffic noise is recommended. 

Will always recommend for my friends and family

reviews.text:
****. Do not walk...run away from this hotel.  I purchased three nights at this hotel so I could take advantage of the spa.  I called ahead and asked if they offered hot stone massage, they did.  I asked if they have male therapist, they did.  I then arrived at the spa.

There were no male therapists.  The hot stone massage was not being offered while I was at the hotel.  The entire reason why I wanted to stay was for the hot stone massage.

I went back to my room and proceeded to meet another occupant in my room.  He was large and was hanging out in my bathroom.  You can probably guess what it was.

I went to the front desk and asked for a refund as I was leaving.  I was told this was not a problem and my refund will hit my account in three days.  A week later I was told 14 days.  Two weeks later I was told any day now.  Well, it is over a month and my money has not been refunded.

Do yourself a favor, do not walk to this spa...run...run away.
reviews.title: Run From This Hotel

reviews.text:
AC was leaking.

Bed sheets, pillow cases and duvet covers were smelly, hairy and dirty.

Stuff were wearing masks but having them hung down their necks!

Changing the dirty sheets took over 75 minutes and they came dirty and full of hair twice until I started to contact the Tourism Police!
reviews.title: Terrible and Dirty

name: Four Seasons Hotel Alexandria
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.
address: 399 El Geish Road, Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text:
We've been wanting to visit FS Alexandria for a long time and we decided to book last minute (the night before our stay) one night before heading to the North Coast. Unlike many hotels, reservations stay late so booking was easy and smooth. Check in was also fast, staff is welcoming and each details is well thought of. 

We booked a pool terrace room, room was spacious and had direct access to the pool. Room had treats and mini robes for my boys which was highly appreciated. Room view was unfortunately not the best, the room was 2 steps lower than the pool so you can't see the pool from the room at all and it's a bit dark. I think next time we will opt for a Sea View room. 

When we arrived it was time for their Friday Brunch so we decided to give it a try. The restaurant by the beach has a beautiful scenic seating and the food was nice with lots of options. Entertainment for the kids was highly appreciated as it it meant we can enjoy the live singers and eating in peace :D. 

There a two  big pools, one in the main building where our room was located and the second one is by the beach, which is the one we spent most our time in as it had the best vibes. There is a big kids area by the beach which was plus. Breakfast was also served at the beach restaurant, options were very nice however the service was a bit slow considering there only a few people.

Check-out was smooth as well. They had cold water bottles prepared for us to take which was a very nice gesture. A staff member helped us with directions and was extremely helpful, he even gave us his phone number incase we got lost or needed his help.

The resort is big, has a beautiful layout and it has something for everyone. It's almost hard to believe that this calming resort is in the middle of the hussle and bussle of the city. We can't wait to go back for a family getaway.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort Amidst a Busy City!

reviews.text: A wonderful experience! An incredible attentive, friendly and professional team! Decor, a beautiful balance of ancient Greco Alexandria to a more modern Arabic feel! A grounded, modern and opulent atmosphere. A creative menu and excellent food in all three restaurants. Tiramisu in Italian restaurant was an extravagant experience and the best I’ve had! I felt at home surrounded with the soul family. It was hard to leave!
reviews.title: A Hotel that felt like Home
reviews.partner_attribution: Review collected in partnership with Four Seasons

Starter of Burrata and tomatoes didn’t live up to anything   Special . But the dessert  was phenomenal ….Tiramisu . All in all I love this hotel for so many wonderful reasons . The bar on 3B is great , love the paneling and atmosphere. Great bartender and the bar has a cigar humidor . Everything you want  in a 5 Star hotel .

reviews.text: The hotel is in a beautiful seaside location with truly lovely rooms and amazing views from every room. And beautiful, friendly and helpful service. An oasis in the middle of chaos on the streets below! We loved so many things about this hotel, including the fact that they tracked down my lost glasses and sent somebody to get them back and then delivered them in a lovely little bag...SERVICE rules here.  There are three things to be aware of when you stay here.  Firstly, if you aren't planning to get a private driver and a guide to take you around, this city would be hard to navigate. Hailing a taxi on street not advised or easy. Streets themselves are an obstacle course, crossing dangerous unless you are an experienced and swift jaywalker :) No marked crossings. Bring your best game of chicken! Fortunately, the hotel has a great driver -- he just needs to be booked ahead through the concierge. Second watchout is that you definitely need to do your own homework regarding restaurants. Concierge here (while jumping through other hoops) is not giving advice in the way you might expect (as in 'here is an amazing place you should check out, stay out of that touristy spot), rather just booking times at your request. Third is that if you don't like noise, even on the 15th floor the heavy traffic below is audible at all times. For a New Yorker, not a big deal. But to be aware of in your thinking. Get some good white noise, or earplugs.  All this said, this is again -- a beautiful oasis. We would definitely keep this as our base of operations if we come back. Thank you to the Four Seasons team for a great stay in a fascinating place!
reviews.title: Four day oasis at the end of a lovely Egypt holiday

reviews.text:
This will be my 1st review in English because this hotel deserves it.  I would give it 5*, but there are a few minor points that decided me to give "only"4*.  Let's begin :

The transfer with their limousine service is excellent but most expensive (120 US$ - 140 US$).  When I arrived at the hotel (3am) the night manager and some staffmembers were awaiting me to bring me asap to my room.  Waaw, what a service was my first thought.
And it was : swift check-in in the room itself !  I really appreciated it that I quickly could take a shower and go to bed after a long  day of travelling.
The room itself was spacious and had all the necessary amenities.  The only thing that bothered me was the shower : old turning system, water not that warm, sometimes almost no pressure and one afternoon no water at all.
The room was also a bit decorated in an old fashioned way, but hey, that's taste.

The next morning I went to have breakfast.  Someone from the reception staff escorted me through the nice, clean tunnel under the busy road to have breakfast in the beachrestaurant.  I was  welcomed by a cheerful and helpful lady who took me to a table and also explained me where I could find everything.  I felt very welcome. Everyone was so very friendly, I almost melted away.

The beach itself is private, safe and rather clean (could be cleaner, but then you have to change the attitude of the guests, you understand what I want to say).
Loungers, towels, and cool water are provided and here also, the staff is very helpful and friendly.

I have to say that this kindness, helpfulness and friendlyness disappeared a bit day after day and I found this quite disappointing.  The same happened with housekeeping.  The difference between the first day and the last is remarkable. It turned their 5*'s into 4*'s.

Minor remark : when I checked-out I told the receptionist that my suitcases were still in the room.  Instead of calling a bellboy of whoever, he gave back my key to  collect them myself.  Weird reaction, but no problem for me.

Conclusion : a very well appointed hotel with friendly and helpful staff.  And if they could hold this attitude up during your whole stay, you cannot be better off in Alexandria.
reviews.title: Excellent but could even be better.

Stayed there for 4 days. If compare with Hilton Corniche the Corinich is better with better service but this is more economic.

Some rooms are facing the mall like the first room that I was given, I checked in on a black Friday and the noise coming from the mall was incredible and verry annoying,

They offer another room on quite back side which was huge and very quite.
Hotel is old and in need of some renovation.

Room was huge with extra double beg and big bathroom.

There was a smell from the Bathroom as water was not going down which was fixed finally after two days.

Lobby is small with a small bar and few sofa and same like most hotel in Egypt, drink were very expensive.

Mall is nothing special but you kill some time there and walk around,

Breakfast was nothing special and not as good as Hilton corniche.

The hotel is huge and some time you need a couple of minutes walk to go to reception.

Pool was big and have some restaurants. Tried the Indian and Thai and both were nice.

reviews.text:
When I did my reservation I did it individual and they didn’t mentioned that they doing renovation in the Montazah park and the hotel is very far away from the park , it needs car to go into the hotel also they  mentioned that there’s a night club inside the hotel with free access for the residents, but also when we checked in we figure out that the club also in renovation ! 
The beach and the pool is too small
The hotel in general is very old fashion but the room is clean and the staff are super friendly specially the receptionist Mr. (Marwan ) he helped us a lot during our stay with a friendly smile and he made our 
vacation much comfortable to us
This hotel is very lucky to have such an employee.

Basma &Faruk
reviews.title: Our vacation in Alex

reviews.text: Small Room and food averaged bad wi fi parking fees big bad sand in beach and beach not clean restaurants not good service and not good clean room please I need more hospitals this big hotel in Egypt thanks
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text:
Excellent hôtel in the middle of mountazah.  It is a historic place  where many Egyptian movies were produced. It is surrounded by a beautiful garden (Mountazah)  and royal palace. 
Very friendly staff and excellent food. The buffet is woow. And the Japanese restaurant is also excellent .
Good for families and holidays also for business .
Thank you, amazing service ❤️. 
Inpive this place .
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text:
I wanted to thank everyone at Helnan Palestine Almontaza specialy Ms Habiba at the front desk! She is so wonderful and so kind! I really enjoyed my stay! Great food and service! 
I’m not sure about the club there it’s not my style but otherwise everything was great thank you all and hope to see you soon again. Love you and will miss you 😘
reviews.title: Lovely and beautiful

reviews.text:
First time to stay in the hotel and it was perfect , the room furniture is good , room view is amazing, restaurant and facilities are great, food quantity is great. 
I believe that I will be staying in this hotel several times in the future.
reviews.title: Perfect experience with Helnan Palestine

reviews.text:
I travel quite a lot and I can say with confidence that Helnan Palestine is a great place. Unfortunately our reservation wasn’t smooth at first and I had to request for management to intervene. 
 Despite the bumpy start, my family and I had a great time. The staff are very professional and pleasant. They were eager to help and make everything convenient. Location is beautiful. My room had a view of it all. I appreciated it how quiet the place was. Breakfast was good and clean. 
I recommend it and I’ll be coming back!
reviews.title: Nice place and great staff

reviews.text: An excellent hotel. The top view in the all Mediterranean Sea. Thanks to all the staff. Very good restaurant . The food is awesome. I spent the new year eve there and really it was Avery unforgettable night. I decided to repeat this visit specially at winter
reviews.title: An excellent hotel

reviews.text:
Hotel is Clean , Staff is Extremely Friendly , Breakfast Quality is quite good , I was given free parking , parking is just in front of the Hotel .

Construction made it quite bad to walk around , it took me almost 10 minutes by car to get to the gate from the hotel which is quite much for me , this used to be one Minute drive.

I think this place is worth a second visit when construction work is over.
reviews.title: Good property , construction made it hard Though

reviews.text:
This is a Scandinavian owned hotel at the edge of the Royal Gardens. Service is wonderful,  the rooms are large and comfortable and all have sea views, some of the beach area and others of the  Royal Palace and the sea. 

Breakfast is excellent as is the wi-fi.

 At the time I stayed (October 2022) much of the gardens and access roads are torn up for reconstruction so driving in can be difficult.

Zanillas Coffee and More,  a nice seaside restaurant  is about a 1 minute walk from the front door.  it has an excellent menu which includes good seafood dishes, as well as burgers, salads,etc.
reviews.title: Good property, some construction in area

reviews.text:
Lovely hotel that is next to the palace. Unfortunately everything was under construction but I’m sure it will be beautiful when completed by the end of the year. The room was comfortable with a mini bar, coffee pot, and safe.
Be careful with the tub when you shower, it is narrow and can be a challenge when moving around.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text:
I visited Helnan Palestine Hotel to attend a conference in Alexandria. When I checked the internet to check the hotel, I was so excited to visit the hotel and walk around the gardens. When I arrived I was disappointed, the whole area is under renovation. We need around 20 minutes to reach the main street from the hotel on foot, and almost all uber drivers refused to enter the hotel area due to the bad roads. The construction is on during the day and till late hours at night. 
The only positive thing about the experience was the sea view, however, it is ruined by the construction noise and dust. We cannot enjoy it and use the room balcony. 
The service was average.  
The front desk officers took a long time to check us. We were three checking in at the same. two key cards did not work, and my colleague who managed to access his room found the maintenance team in his room. He had to wait for another 15 minutes to get his room.
reviews.title: Disappointed - "Area Under Renovation"

reviews.text:
Mohamed Ayman the hotel receptionist was ensuring that we have the feeling of it being a home away from home. his aim is guest satisfaction and quality delivery.

He takes our commitments seriously and I touched that he always hope to meet the others guest's expectation.

Really he is a very good example for the hospitality
reviews.title: Excellent FO Team

reviews.text:
Positives:
Hotel is located in a Royal paradise. Beautiful views from all aspects.
Lovely premises.
Excellent staff especially Marawan at front desk.
Perfect check in and out with flexibility😉
Very nice terraces with cool breeze 👌
Car services including parking and free car wash!
You get excellent WiFi all over the hotel !!!!

Disliked · Terrible near abouts because of heavy constructions now! Making it really difficult to reach this lovely hotel.
Noisy neighbourhood but can be managed with the tight sealed balcony glass.
Swimming is not pleasant because of turbid sea shore and pool too!!! Pool is small 4 the number of guests too.
Breakfast is "fair"
reviews.title: Wait till the constructions around are done !!!

reviews.text:
We were looking forward to a quiet and peaceful couple of days and we were truly disappointed. No one took the time to warn us about the renovation going on in the area when we booked on the phone. We were told that everything was wheelchair accessible, which isn't true.

- What was once a beautiful garden leading to the hotel is now a series of sandy, dusty, noisy beaten paths. 

-The "sea view" from our room is riddled with construction cranes.

- The view from the beach is on an old building under construction.

- You need to take a shuttle bus to go from the hotel to the street since it is impossible to walk across garden on foot. Very not wheelchair accessible. 

- There are stairs leading from the beach to the sea even though we were told that the access to the beach and to the sea was wheelchair accessible. 

- The noise from the construction is constant and unbearably loud.
reviews.title: WARNING: Area under construction

reviews.text:
I liked the comfortable bed, TV channels, sea view and staff and room is clean and nice weather. 

I did not like the construction around the hotel , pool small especially for weekends. One of the best beaches for Alex but not the cleanest in Egypt . Spa is expensive .
reviews.title: Family vacation

reviews.text: The Hotel is not the best among the hotels in Alexandria. Hotel location is very far from main city 1 hr driving. Any entrainment activities is for extra charge ex pool tables. Both swimming pools are in maintenance. GYM is good. Breakfast is good. Drinks in dinner for extra charge. Only small bottle of water available for each day is not enough for one person, you need to bring your own water with you. Rooms are very big and clean, but uncomfortable to sleep at night because of the sound the cars on the highway. No bracelets to identify your stay. You are requested to sign out every time you have a mael in the restaurant even if it is included in your stay. Parking is avaliable for free. Wifi is good and speed is good.

The hotel is  very good and close to the airport, but about one hour drive from the main tourist attractions and city center, so one should take that into account before booking.

reviews.text:
Very good hotel, excellent breakfast and good restaurants. The SPA at 3rd floor is very good but after 5pm there’s only one therapist. This is an item to be improved: the SPA should have more therapists during the evening time, as people go for visits and come back to hotel in the end of the afternoons.

As for the staff, we have to say that it was the best thing of our stay. Very nice, attentive and kind employees.

A special remark for Mr. TAREK who took care of us with maximum attention and kindness. Thanks Mr. TAREK!

In general, our stay was very pleasant (in spite of short) and, for sure, it’s a place to return

I strongly recommend Radisson Blu Alexandria!

reviews.text: If you want the feel of a grand old hotel in the heart of Alexandria at a reasonable price, this is the place. It is located at the center of Alexandria within a 10 minute drive from the most important sites, and right across from the Mediterranean and the Cleopatra Column. Super friendly staff. You are welcomed with a refreshment of coffee, tea and small pastries. There is a complimentary buffet for a light evening meal (mostly English tea time small sandwiches, etc.). Breakfast buffet was mostly Egyptian fare, with only a few European offerings. Ask for a room with a great view of the sea. The only disappointment was very weak internet.  Overall a great experience.
reviews.title: Grand Old Hotel at a reasonable price

reviews.text:
Very luxury, clean and tidy place where all the staff do their best to enjoy your stay and make it comfortable.
Starting from the Concierge where its staff with their beautiful uniform meet you at the gate and handle the luggage in a professional way to keep it safe. Thanks to Mr. Ragab. then you meet the staff at the front desk to receive your room. With a smile face, the staff help you to select the most relevant room to your need where you can enjoy the location, quiet and cleanness. Thanks to Mr. Ahmed Hassan, Mr. Mohamed Ibrahim and Miss Olya.
The Gourmandise restaurant is very Delightfully place where you enjoy delicious food and beverage. Thanks to Chef Tamer, Capt. Maghawry, Capt.  M. Basiouny, Capt. Hamed , Capt. Nabil and Miss Nehal.
From the room service, my deep thanks to Eslam and Shaarawy
reviews.title: I will stay in this Hotel in all my travel to Alex. and I recommend it to all my friends.

owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
It was a solo traveler vacation just for relaxing. And as expected from a brand like Hilton, it really met my expectations. A hassle free from everything from the beginning. 

Valet parking upon arriving, Check-in was easy, receptionist provided multi options , and i chose the most convenient, high floor (7th) with a direct sea view.  

Room space was OK for a solo, view from the balcony was marvelous. 
Went for a walk at night, lot's of good restaurants nearby, found a seafood one with a good Google reviews.

For the beach, you feel the privacy, especially when you look at the nearby hell crowded public beach. However, the sea itself is not clean (full of Garbage), although the team is making a great efforts to clean it , but of course it's a mission impossible. They should implement an engineered solution for this issue. Life guard is fully attentive & gives a good instructions before you start swimming. 

For the food, i ordered an in-room breakfast from the room service. A good variety & taste as well, especially the falafel plate. (Just a remark , i had a difficulty to order as all room phones needs to be fixed).

Didn't try the pool as it was full of kids & i tried to avoid the noisy places. So, the beach was more convenient for me. The beach access requires to pass the road, but the hotel provides a shuttle bus to & from the beach. (Good Point).

What i didn't like is the parking fees, 150L.E per day. I think this shouldn't exist either for them or any other hotel. It should be complimentary.

Overall, the staff is very friendly & doing a great efforts to please the guests. Which i think it's the key success of this hotel.
reviews.title: A great short vacation

reviews.text:
- Our corner room was supposed to have partial ocean view but, being on Level 1, we had almost private access to the full terrace with amazing views of both the ocean and the pool.
 - Restaurant La Gourmandise aka Executive Lounge:  Evening buffet, unlike those at lounges in other hotels, was a *dinner* buffet where there were always 3 kinds of protein (chicken, lamb, beef) and 4 kinds of starch (potatoes, rice, pasta, breads) every night.  They were always delicious and authentically Egyptian. Service was attentive from everyone, from the Chefs at the ready in serving the hot dishes, to the waiters, and the hosts --- especially the 2 Captains, Mohamed and Mahmoud, who were always enthusiastically cheerful and welcoming.
- Our stay would have been perfect if not for the following 2 problems: Starting around 10 am, seriously loud and obnoxious banging/knocking noises were, not only heard, but felt in our room.  On the first day, we tried to suffer for an hour before going out.  However, on the 2nd morning when we intended to rest before leaving, it was unbearable with these noises.  I called the front desk to complain and was told by a woman that she would check with Maintenance and called back, but never did.  I then came down to talk to the woman sitting at the HHonors desk about this problem:  She said nothing and walked away. While the 2 gentlemen at the front desk were very courteous and helpful and knowledgeable, the same could not be said about our checkout experience with the woman at the front desk.  She took our payment and gave us a small credit-card receipt.  When asked for a full invoice showing what we paid for, she claimed that we should have received the invoice at the check-in time.  It took some back-and-forth dispute and waiting before she finally agreed to produce the proper invoice for the hotel stay.
reviews.title: Amazing terrace & dinner buffet, but uneven service

reviews.text:
Even if the staff is very helpful, friendly and polite the building should not even have a habitability permit because of the terrible conditions.
The hotel is located on 9th floor of an unsafe building. There are 3 elevators but just 1 is working, the door of the elevator is missing and the roof is a dump -so you could see the wall just passing by. Many floors of the building are abandoned and are also a dump. Since the elevator is not safe, we took the stairs and the stairs have a mountain of garbage and a deposit of old furniture and construction leftovers. The building is not safe neither from the structural point of view nor sanitary.
reviews.title: The entire bulding is not safe

Le seul point positif - l'emplacement sur la corniche et vue sur mer.

reviews.text:
اوتيل سئ للغاية اضطريت للاقامة فيه لمدة ليلة كانت من أوحش الليالي.
بداية من المسئول حتى العفش.. الأبواب كلها شرخ. الحمامات سيئة ومستواها متدني جداالتكييفات بايزة وطلبت تصليحها ما اتصلحتش.. اتنقلت غرفة تانية دخلت البلكونة لاقيت نفسي عايمة في بركة مياه بسبب التكييف برضه ولما حبيت اسيب الأوتيل قوبلت باساءة بالغة وتطاول وصوت عالي من المسئول ومنتهى عدم الذوق.. بياض الحيطان الغرف مقشر من على الحيطة.. التلفزيون صغير جدا وقديم جدا والقنوات غير واضحة. من الاخر مفيش حاجة عدلة وما انصحش أي حد يضيع فلوسه ولا راحته فيه

name: Smoha Zahran Haus
address: 35 El-Moustashar Mahmoud El-Attar, Ezbet Saad, Sidi Gaber, Alexandria 1111 Egypt

reviews.text:
Apesar de constar no Booking como um hotel, na verdade é um apartamento familiar onde a família aluga um quarto para hóspedes. Foi um pouco difícil localizá-lo porque ele fica no 7º andar de um prédio e não possui identificação externa.
Mas no final das contas valeu a pena, o quarto é espaçoso, a cama talvez tenha umas das mais, senão a mais, confortáveis que já dormi em hospedagem na minha vida; a família é simpática e acolhedora, principalmente a dona do imóvel, que falava muito bem inglês.

Although it appears on Booking as a hotel, it is actually a family apartment where the family rents a room for guests. It was a little difficult to locate him because he is on the 7th floor of a building and has no external identification.
But in the end it was worth it, the room is spacious, the bed may have one of the most, if not the most, comfortable beds I've ever slept with in my life; the family is friendly and welcoming, especially the owner of the property, who spoke very good english.
reviews.title: Melhor cama onde já dormi / Best bed I've ever slept in

photos.caption: Essa é a fachada do prédio pra ajudar as pessoas a encontrarem ele. This is the facade of the building to help people find it.

reviews.text: Dirty and smelly rooms, false advertisement and deceiving information, no wifi, dirty kitchen, stain on bed sheets and towels, no scheduled cleaning, and manger work offsite, appear to collect money and takes the key at the end. Not very helpful and has excused for everything. The bathrooms have strong sewage oder coming out of it, and not very healthy environment without opening the windows. I am not sure how they manage to be listed in the travel sites, I thought there are criteria for listing a property.
reviews.title: Stay away from this place

reviews.text:
Stayed for two weeks here. It is an apartment building that belongs to a hotel, that is quite far away.On the internet they promise breakfast/restaurant, but that is not in this building. Sheets have not been changed in two weeks, towels just once. I cannot see a vacuum cleaner being used in the room. Especially the rooms at the front are quite noisy.
But there is a small shop below where you can buy food for breakfast very cheep. The internet works perfectly and the place indeed has a sea view and some nice restaurants close by at the seaside. Montazah park is near for a nice walk. The price is great for a four room apartment.
So good and bad.
reviews.title: Not great, but not expensive either

reviews.text: We booked online, a 4 double room with only le 380, the appartment is nice big, each bedroom has its own tv, receiver, bathroom..very clean sheets, with a full equipped kitchen and a dinning area.free wifi strong 📶... Only two disadvantages the first is that the bathrooms are smelly as off problems in pipes..the floor is carpet which is not suitable..also ups and down in the floor. But all in all it is amazingly clean peaceful place to stay.We will book again definitely.
reviews.title: One night in a lovely place

reviews.text:
That was a nice place to stay in and so affordable for a big family. It's composed of a clean apartment containing 3 separate room with ensuite bathroom each, and a kitchen available for all the rooms with a seating area. All rooms are air-conditioned, with flat TV, and free Wifi. Every morning your breakfast will be served to your apartment. 
I do recomment this hotel, but in case you will need a car or use taxis (whch are totally available) to get to the downtown, as this hotel is close to Montazah.
reviews.title: Great Stay for a big family

reviews.text: The hotel have nice view of montazah park and hilton hotel and all furnature new but its too far from downtown and metro stations , i think that the old hotel "alexander the great " at mansheia area location is perfect and the hotel was so good more than this one .... But i like my stay her but the place was far
reviews.title: Nice view but too far form downtown

reviews.text: This hotel has a great, very kind and helpful staff. And whereas cleanliness isn't self-evident at all in cheaper Egyptian hotels (less than 5 stars), the Alexander The Great Montazah Hotel (not Motazah) may have discovered a gap in the market! It isn't expensive but it's rooms and even the bathrooms are really, very clean! Some rooms have sea view, and anyway the sea is a minute walk away. All rooms have their own air-conditioning. We spent wonderful 7 days here!
reviews.title: A clean hotel

photos.caption: View from the balcony of room 5

reviews.text:
I only read the very first review after I stayed. I too confused the 2 hotels.  Not a bad place, but unless you have specific plans up this end of Alex, Im not sure why you would stay. Plus's - clean, staff friendly, big rooms, internet good. If you have back or hip issues, beware that they have (very clean/new) foam mattresses, no spring support.  I have come across this a few times in Egypt, mainly in cheaper places.
DIRECTIONS (save you money!). If you find yourself staying here, get taxi to stop JUST before the Sheraton driveway - before it goes around corner. You should see a street/alley that forks into 2. Take the right hand side. Walk past the corner supermarket (RHS), and you will see a few steps ahead some steps leading up to what looks like residential building. The hotel sign is purple above door. Go up 2 floors (walking the stairs) and you will see entrance. Its one level, with rooms coming off common area reception. Locals DO NOT KNOW THIS HOTEL.  I was lost with driver for about 1 hour, finally I walked up to the Sheraton & 1 employee knew and showed me.

TIPS that are not related to hotel. 1) Going to the beach to sit? prepare to pay money, even if you just want to take pictures EGP 10-18 depending. Food is everywhere, but ask staff for recommendations. If solo female traveller like me, expect men in cars to stop in front of you while you are blissfully walking (yes, covered head to toe too). It happened at least once every 10 minutes. This blemished my experience of Alex but unfortunately its a sad truth, if you travel with a male Im sure it wont happen. Solo traveller, be aware that taxi drivers will try to rip you off. Dont pay more than EGP100 from one end to other of Alex.
reviews.title: Dont confuse with the other Alex the Great

reviews.text:
I stayed here recently and made the mistake of confusing this hotel with Alexander the Great, near the Greek Churh. This is the Motazah Alexander the Great- two very different hotels!
The room was superb, large, spacious, clean and tidy.
The staff were excellent, extremely helpful and knowledgeable of the local area and taxi prices. It was very easy to pick up a cab from outside.
The hotel itself was tricky to find, even for the locals. Nestled in a traditional local area, be prepared to get up close and personal with Egyptian culture!
Near to the market, enjoyable for an evening stroll.
reviews.title: Great staff, poor location

reviews.text: Отель чистый, уютный, комфортабельный, с качественным ремонтом. Номер просторный, с большой кровать., холодильником и чайником. Отель не сложно найти, главное ориентироваться на собор.  Услужливый персонал, вкусный завтрак. александрия встретила нас большими пробками, долго долго ехали до отеля, и напрочь отпало желание передвигаться на авто, после того как заселились в номер - гуляли пешком, получалось передвигаться быстрее.
reviews.title: Александрия

reviews.text: An oasis of calm, style and service. They have managed to maintain a superb, classy ambience admist the filthy, noisy chaos that is Alexandria. Beautiful interiors, well maintains. Stylish bedrooms, marble bathroom, all appliances work, helpful, knowledgable and efficient staff.
reviews.title: Golden Age of Travel experience on a budget

reviews.text: I did write my input once I was done my dinner however trip advisor refused to publish my feedback for some reason. The food served was awful the soup was like coloured water, the used frozen vegetables in the salad with the price point for a fresh salad @175 ep. Those were the starter the main course my wife selected the seafood plated which was much overcooked and tasteless and I ordered the rack of lamb and requested rare with French fries it came well done and very dry, with frozen French fries. The maître d’hôtel took the plate away and came back 10 minutes later with the rack almost like raw and I refused to eat it because of the health risk we ended up taking our costly dinner in a bag for our puppies please see the dining receipt and observe the photos will never go back it’s a joke to have to spend $1600 ep and to leave hungry!!! Please publish as is?
reviews.title: Very poor dining experience at the hotel main dining room.

reviews.text: The room was very nice and tidy with a nice Seaview. All the stuff was very nice and friendly my children loved them vey much.  It's already my favourite place in alex I will come back again very soon
reviews.title: Best Hotel in alex

reviews.text: Good, central location for exploring Alexandria. However, buyer beware. When I booked, I was offered two rates: an attractive rate without breakfast, and a considerably higher rate with breakfast. I chose the higher rate with breakfast,  but my confirmation charged me for the higher rate "exclusive of breakfast." In spite of sending screen shots to both the hotel and Steigenberger, both washed their hands of responsibility. If you book, take the lowest rate and do what I ended up doing - walk across the street to Les Delices, a fabulous French bakery, and order breakfast for about 1/4 the price.
reviews.title: Bait and Switch: Booked at Low Price, Billed at Higher Price

reviews.text:
We had a lovely stay at the Steigenbrger Cecil Hotel in December. We were fortunate and were able to stay in the Agatha Christie suite. Our room had a balcony overlooking the sea, which provided breathtaking views and a lovely place to relax. The room itself was spacious and well-appointed, with comfortable furnishings and all the necessary amenities.

Breakfast was also a highlight of our stay. The buffet offered a good variety of options, including hot and cold dishes, fresh fruits, pastries and juice. The staff was friendly and attentive, ensuring that all guests had everything they needed to start the day off right.

The location of the hotel is also perfect, with easy access to the sea and all the local attractions. The hotel staff is also friendly and helpful, and they were always willing to offer recommendations and assistance.

Overall, I would highly recommend this historic hotel to anyone looking for a unique and memorable experience. The combination of a beautiful historic building, a balcony overlooking the sea and a good breakfast make it an excellent choice for travelers looking to explore the local area and experience the rich history and culture of the region.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: Visited in November 2022 with my elderly parents, brother and 2 year old son. The hotel team was very accommodating to all our varied needs. The breakfast buffet was great and a selection to satisfy any diet or desire. Espresso based beverages were of a high quality. The rooms were very comfortable and large in a more historical style. The 1st floor (2nd floor for the North Americans) was full of dark wood and big leather arm chairs. The perfect place to enjoy one of their signatures cocktails in a relaxed environment. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to any group of travellers.
reviews.title: Buffet, room, bar and service was excellent!

Cecil Hotel is beautiful. The decor takes you to a bygone era of glamour and luxury. We had a room with a view of the sea. 

Many famous people once stayed there, including Om Kalthoum and Winston Churchill.

The service is excellent and the food is delicious in the restaurant as well as at the bar, which serves alcohol as well as non-alcoholic drinks.

Attentive staff. Excellent service.
