Please don’t ever think to stay in this absolutely horrible hotel.That’s not a Hotel, it’s a real disgusting.
There are hundreds of hotels in Alexandria and definitely this is by far the worst ever.

The only good thing about the Hotel are the workers, at the bar and some of the receptionists.
reviews.title: Terrific

reviews.text: Had a really nice time in Alexandria and the Ramsis hotel was great, clean rooms, lovely people and great views of the med. The city was a little run down but full of lovely people. The staff at the Ramsis made our stay very enjoyable.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text:
We stayed at the hotel in November, 2017. It's a very old building, with a wonderful sea view. 

The staff are awesome, always willing to help and give tips. The only downside is that some rooms don't have shower boxes in their bathrooms, making it almost impossible to have a proper shower! 

Do ask for rooms that have shower boxes in advance. Enjoy taking the elevator there!
reviews.title: Great choice for budget travelers

reviews.text:
I really enjoyed my 2 nights stay, room was clean and tidy, 24h free wifi. 
The only drawback is the elevator it needs maintainance we had to use help to take our bags up as the there was an elevator problem. Otherwise me and my mom loved the place and ISA if we have time next year for vacation we will reserve there.
reviews.title: Liked the place

reviews.text:
Stayed there for 2 days. Great location. Clean rooms, needs some rennovations specially the bathrooms but for the money paid couldnt ask for more. 
Friendly staff and very helpful and always there for any help or if u have any question. 
Speciall thanks to Mina who was the first one to meet and was very friendly and helpful. Got the rooms ready in few minutes. 
Also special thanks to Gina, Amr and Nader for making our stay great. Highly recommend this place and definitely will be back
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text:
You will love how close it is to the sea , the morning breeze is so beautiful. 
Great value for the money , and it's a walking distance from downtown. 
It's not a fancy hotel but if you are on a tight budget, RAMSIS is where you should stay.
reviews.title: Amazing View

reviews.text: Perfect location in the heart of Alex, amazing sea view,  cozy , staff are friendly and helpful, neat and clean, the old style of the building and the hotel is very nice, pretty cheap. Plumbing needs to be fixed though.
reviews.title: Cairo

reviews.text:
The good: Location, location. The hotel is right on the Corniche which was definitely convenient and the sea view from our room was lovely, but cost more (we'd reserved a standard room but it was so dismal, we paid extra for the sea view). Room had a small refrigerator.

The bad: The bed didn't have a second pillow; we had to ask. The room's light didn't work; we had to call a technician. Water in bathroom didn't work after flushing the toilet, and we never had enough pressure to shower, so it was good we were only there one night. Technician couldn't fix it. The room had no towels; we had to ask. And what they gave us were so small, even if we'd had water to shower, we couldn't have dried ourselves! 

Staff at the front desk were polite but only one of them was really helpful.  Breakfast was average with marginal service. When we checked out I was annoyed to be charged extra for my second cup of lousy coffee. especially given how many of the basics didn't work.
reviews.title: Great location - rest of it not so good

reviews.text:
Good sea view , I like it 
Staff are very friendly , old furniture , old style , poor hospitality facilities as a hotel 

The mist amazing thing here is the fabulous sea view , climate , and my wife & my son
reviews.title: Good place

reviews.text:
I stayed in here for one night and I really love the old charm of this hotel. The hotel is situated in the downtown of Alexandria with amazing full sea view. the staff is excelent and helpful. The hotel building is old but the rooms are very confortable and very clean.
And the best thing in Ramsis hotel is the amazing Cornishe view from rooms balcony.
reviews.title: I love it

reviews.text: This hotel has a fabulous location, with sea views.  But the building is extremely old and run down.  The toilet leaked all over he floor and we couldn't even use the shower.  It is barely one star standard and desperately in need of some refurbishment.
reviews.title: Great location but very run down

reviews.text:
Situated just at the beginning of the corniche hub, Ramsis is a good budget option when looking for accommodation. 
Pros: good location, walking distance to the library and corniche, helpful staff, good breakfast (eggs, bread, salad, cheese, juice and coffee/tea).
Drawbacks: the wifi wasn't working properly but the staff did apologise for this, initially we were in a room with a tiny bathroom (you would have to sit on the toilet to have a proper shower) but after highlighting this to staff, they moved us to a different room which had a slightly bigger shower area! 

All in all, a decent stay! Would recommend!
reviews.title: Good budget option

reviews.text: Me and my 4 friends checked in here for 2 nights between September 19-21, 2015. Hotel staff, especially the reception really took an effort to feel the guests of a warmth welcome. Hotel’s cleanliness is very much essential that’s why they make sure of a morning door knock in for daily room cleaning service. Breakfast served is a typical Egyptian menu. Location is very much strategic for a tourist since most of the places to see are accessible by minutes of walk. The best of what this Hotel can offer is the "panoramic views" of Alexandria's Mediterranean coastlines right within the Hotel room's veranda. We wouldn’t have a second thought of checking in to this Hotel again once we visit Alexandria in a near future.
reviews.title: A Hotel with Panoramic Views !!!

reviews.text:
The hotel is small, but is very cozy! The staff is excelent and helpfull.
The rooms are confortable, the bathroom is small and the shower its not very good
The rooms are very clean!
The location is excelent!!
Was the best hotel because of the staff, they are all very nice, its a familiar hotel!
reviews.title: The best hotel in my tour around Egypt

the hotel needs renovations at many levels , but the view of the sea is unique

reviews.text: Checkin was the most difficult experience I've had at a hotel. Probably should have gone elsewhere. They made many photocopies of several pages of our passports. They only take cash and insist that foreign currency be top quality. Staff talked loudly through all hours of the night. Bathroom shower was broken. Staff 'supervised' us as we ate breakfast. This was something to laugh about later, but I would not recommend and would not stay again under any circumstance. Wifi did not work.

reviews.text: It was a nice and relax night in Alexandria. Staff is good, breakfast is fine. Problems in the bathroom, solved promptly. Location is near to the sea and shopping street. No near beach or pool but perfect for those who will spend 1 or 2 nights for relaxing.
reviews.title: Nice relax stay

reviews.text: This is a small hotel that seems to be a hole in the wall. However, one you enter the room, you will realise that it is very comfortable.The beds are comfortable and the place is very clean. The only problem is that there is no wifi in the room. The people are very very friendly. We had a communication barrier as we did not speak Arabic but somehow we managed to have a conversation with them. They were very nice and even offered to make anything we wanted for breakfast, including falafels! :) The price is reasonable and it is conveniently located too.
reviews.title: Very warm and cosy hotel!

reviews.text: اكثر ما يميز هذا الفندق رحابة الاستقبال والروح العالية التي يمتلكها موظفين الاستقبال من الابتسامه وسرعة التجاوب مع الناس علاوة على ان موقع الفندق مميز حيث انه قريب جدا من البحر و المحلات التجارية والمطاعم مساحة الغرف معقولة ومقبولة

reviews.text: L'hôtel est très bien situé. Le personnel ne parle pas français, parfois pas anglais, mais est serviable et souriant. La connexion Internet n'est pas très bonne dans la chambre. Celle-ci disposait d'une vue... sur la buanderie. La chambre était bruyante car très mal isolée, nous entendions donc les portes claquer, les cris des enfants, etc. D'ailleurs, les odeurs de cigarettes passaient aussi. Par contre, les chambres sont propres. Le petit-déjeuner est sans intérêt. Vu l'ambiance de l'établissement, je pense qu'il est préférable de ne pas y boire d'alcool...
reviews.title: Mouais...

reviews.text:
أقمت في هذا المكان في الفترة من ١-٣أغسطس
اساسا مافيش فندق هو شقة شاهقة الارتفاع تم تقسيمها عرضيا تضاعفت مساحتها وتحولت الي بنسيون نظيف 

موقع جيد جدا وقريب من البحر وكل مناطق الإسكندرية العتيقة  -أثاث جديد ومريح -مستوي من النظافة لا بأس به--إدارة حازمة ومحترمة ومتعاونة

مناسب حدا لمن يبحث عن مكان نظيف و مريح للنوم
reviews.title: المتيا-مصر

reviews.text:
Wij hebben 5 nachten in dit hotel geslapen, omdat wij aan het wachten waren op onze auto die verscheept is naar Alexandrië. 
Super leuk hotel. Word gerund door een wat ouder echtpaar. Super lieve mensen. Kregen elke ochtend heerlijk ontbijt van Mevrouw. Wifi is aanwezig. Alles ziet er netjes uit en het is centraal gelegen in een leuk straatje tegenover een ander groot hotel.
reviews.title: Super hotel!

reviews.text: اعجبني في هذا الفندق سرعة تسجيل الدخول في الفندق وجميع طاقم الفندق مهتمين تمامًا بالنظافة تمامًا وقربه من الأسواق والكافيهات والمطاعم وأيضًا قربه من البحر تقريبًا 5 دقائق مشي على الاقدام، يأتيني الإفطار أي وقت أطلبه ليس بوفيه وإنما نظام انتركونتينينتال وممكن التغيير في الإفطار حسب الطلب .

reviews.text: The rooms are very good and well furnished, the staff are super friendly, the food is good, the room service is good with several varieties, and the room cleanliness is perfect. I enjoyed my stay. I would recommend this place.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: This brand new hotel inside the maamoura are is an excellant choice to stay in during summer and winter. Maamoura is a private area with fees for admission, long beach and sea side walk. Area for aqua sports, Sunny in most times of the year making it an ecellant choice for those looking for clean safe area to spent a vacation
reviews.title: A new choice in alexandria

name: Fouad Hotel
address: 1 Digla St., Alramel Station, Corniche Road, Alexandria 00203 Egypt

reviews.text: I was a great experience for me to stay in this place and see different foreigners visiting Alexandria staying at this hotel. The place was very clean and the staff is friendly. The location also is fantastic
reviews.title: Different experience

reviews.text:
Located right on the waterfront way Corniche, this place offers a nice balcony view from its rooms (which is a "pretty expansive" view mainly of the Mediterranean Sea straight ahead but also encompassing a part of the city's skyline "to the left" and also the Qaitbay Citadel but just in its "pretty small shape" at some distance across the water), and it's a location "quite central" I would say full of many miscellaneous shops and above all some good places to eat (McDonald's where I had breakfasts at about a 5-minute walk away, and two restaurants called Bazooka & Cafe de la Paix where I had lunches right beside this hotel building but each on an "opposite side" of the building), and yes from this central location is also just like 10-to-15-minute taxi rides to all the "main sites" of the city (Qaitbay Citadel, Roman Theater, Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa & Pompey's Pillar).  Also, my "many thanks" are for the manager Salah whose helpfulness & cooperation made my 3-night stay a pleasant one.

Just a little on the down side with this place for me was my room being "a bit cramped" and some inconvenience of having to walk up the stairs for about two levels of a big heritage building with "high ceilings" (making the stairways here somewhat longer than those in modern buildings).
reviews.title: An "ok stay" at the waterfront :)

photos.caption: A zoomed-in view of the Qaitbay Citadel (from the balcony of my room)
A wide-open view of the Mediterranean Sea except for like a rock boundary at some distance from the waterfront (from the balcony of my room)
In the Building but outside this hotel
The main street on one side of the hotel building (to the left after coming out of the Building)
My room with 2 beds and the door to the balcony
My room with 2 beds (& also an ensuite bathroom just beside one bed)
A part of the city's waterfront skyline seen "to the left" (from the balcony of my room)
The busy area with a small square & a street intersection (at just about a 5-minute walk from this hotel building)
The waterfront view "to the right" (from the balcony of my room)

reviews.text: Spacious room. Good location, located in the downtown Alexandria. KFC, McDonald are very close. The tram stop is located just opposite. The Alexandria fort and the Railway station is located within 1-2 km. It is located very close to sea.
reviews.title: Located in the downtown

reviews.text:
I can’t stay for one night

reviews.title: Not recommended

reviews.text:
This was my first time trying a quite excellent low budget accommodation.
I likes the place. It was very cozy. The orice was excellent in comparison to the length of tge stay.
It is a family-run business. The manager, his wife and son are very helpful.
The rate of cleanliness was astonishingly high. I felt like I was in a home-stay room.
I recommend this place to any travellers who look for an affordable, yet great, accommodation.
reviews.title: Cozy & Nice Low Budget Accommodation

reviews.text:
This hotel exceeded my expectations. I stayed for only two nights and I regret not staying longer.

The location is perfect, right on Cornish. Five minutes walk to Raml station where you can find lots of cafes, restaurants, shops. Alexandria train station is within walking distance as well. Public transportation is available - trams, microbuses, taxis as well as Uber and Careem.

I really loved the room. It was small, but cozy and clean. Extra blankets are available in the wardrobe as it feels cold at night. The room had a balcony with a breathing view of Corniche. Absolutely gorgeous at sunset. I wasn't bothered by noise from the street, if I kept my balcony doors closed I didn't hear it. There was more noise from the reception area.

The staff was friendly and accommodating. In the morning a simple breakfast is served in the room: fresh warm bread, boiled egg, jam, butter, cheese. They don't bring it automatically, so you just have to ask the reception and they bring it within a few minutes. Turkish coffee is for extra charge of 20 EGP, very delicious.

I would definitely stay again at this hotel and recommend to anyone for a budget trip.
reviews.title: Lovely and cozy

reviews.text: L'accueil est glacial, on pense entrer chez des gens par erreur. Toutes la famille est en pijama et tongues. L'eau est froide, les toilettes sont cassées et goûtent toute la nuit. Les fenêtres n'isolent en rien du bruit de la corniche (voitures, klaxon etc...) Aucun drap ni aucune serviette ne sont fournies. Pas de petit déjeuner et l'endroit est très sale et délabré. Le paiement est demandé en liquide et en livres égyptiennes au milieu du séjour par du "personnel" très peu aimable. Nous avions l'impression de devoir de l'argent à la Mafia... Les équipements (une télé et un frigo) sont d'un autre âge et particulièrement sale. À fuir absolument.
reviews.title: Une honte

reviews.text: The location is great u cross the street and u r on the best location to view the sea however the rooms not that great only 2 rooms or 3 have sea frontal view ,the partial sea view which i had was hideous it had a horrible building ruins and u can see a tiny part of the sea barely visible the hotel is very small and its truely very slow in service the room i had was Santorini i think  it looked nice but u could hear the water pipes all night it was very noisy  but the night staff are very helpful he even opened his netflix for me 🤣 defenitly visit but make sure u take a fromt sea room and nothing else then u will have a great time

reviews.text:
This review is written by a travel consultant with 4 years of experience, so honesty and transparency is 100% guaranteed.

The hotel staff, room, and location went above and beyond my expectations.

The view of the sea is spectacular!! and the room is sparkling clean..

It is safe to say that everything about this hotel is nothing but PERFECT!

I stayed there for 2 nights, and on the night of my first night, Ms. Amal called me and told me that the owner would like to give us a complimentary breakfast the next day at Cafe De La Paix.

Sadly I got really really sick because of some bad food I ate at Skyroof restaurant the previous day.. so unfortunately I missed the breakfast and went to the hospital.
After I came back, Ms. Amal came to my room to check on me and gave me and my mom complimentary kettle, tea, coffee, and a bowl of all kinds of healthy nuts to help me recover.

The level of hospitality at this property makes you feel at home ❤

This was my first time, but definitely not the last. I don't think any other hotel in Alexandria can exceed my expectations like this one ❤
reviews.title: EXCELLENT 5 STARS SERVICE!!

name: Eastern Al Montazah Hotel
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.
address: El Malek Street, Alexandria 12345 Egypt

reviews.text:
Eastern Montazah is located in Florence Mega Mall. Entrance looks nice and chic.
Mr Michael ( at the front desk ), upgraded our room to a pool view one.
There are 2 pools at the hotel.
Room is clean, so is the bathroom.
( In case you felt you need them to change your bedsheets, you can always ask.)
Staff are hard working.
We enjoyed the breakfast. It has many varieties.
Mrs. Mona at the restaurant, very welcoming and smile never leave her face. She makes sure that you have everything you need.
Mrs Rehab, listened carefully to our feedback and made sure all is good and that we enjoyed our stay.

Free Wifi is available in rooms.
Parking is available with extra charge but you'll find parking place outside the hotel.
( Neighboorhood isn't that good so it's better you have a car. )

Hotel is recommended if you are searching for a clean and nice hotel, this one is a value deal.
reviews.title: Nice and clean.

reviews.text: From the check-in to the checkout, the staff made us very welcoming, Sayed upgraded our room to a suite, cheers. Breakfast was very nice, room was super spacious with big balcony. I would like to thank Mina from the coffee house, such an amazing guy, was very responsive and helpful and always smiling, and two young handsome guys in the restaurant keep up with the smile &  great working spirit, and not to be forgotten from front office Michael, you are a wonderful person and truly appreciate your hospitality and kindness, keep up with the beautiful service that you provided to us, made us feel very welcoming, cheers to Mr. Michael and Mr. Mina
reviews.title: The best staff

reviews.text:
The hotel view is very bad however the furniture was amazing but when you deal with the receiption staff you will discover that they are very rude and they never know how to deal with customers except with lies and loud voices .they close the room cards around 11oclock for 3rooms already despite that accomodation fees was already  paid by the travel agency and when I complained the receiption girl close also the telephone and there is no manager to escalate or even to solve any problems.

Breakfast also is very poor and they charge children same as adult!!!!
Very disappointing experience with a horrible staff I recommend to avoid dealing with  such a hotel with this unprofessional management.
reviews.title: Worst staff

reviews.text:
We had visited Alexandria for just 2 days on holiday and were extremely disappointed with this hotel. It is in the middle of nowhere, hotel is in a  mall , reception is on the 1st floor and the decor sucks. 
Rooms for the hotel are only on 2 floors and the ambience is far from a 5 Star ! They do not have a credit card reader, the phone in the room was not working which was fixed subsequently . We were given a room on the 11th floor which does not even have a proper view.
This hotel is ok if you are coming here for a business meeting and just want to stay the night as the room is large and clean. But that is about all you can expect here . 
I don’t know why this is shown as 5 Star - it is very misleading when making a booking as there is a basic standard one expects from a 5 Star .
reviews.title: Certainly not 5 Star

name: New Capri Hotel
address: 8th fl, 23 Sharia El-Mena Al-Sharkya, Alexandria 0020 Egypt

reviews.text:
Surprisingly great experience , we had to stay few night in Alexandria , there was almost no rooms at any hotel and we found this 2 stars hotel , so we booked it as no other choice.
We were treated royaly with nice smile and very warm welcome by the lady at the reception ( Yara ) , a nice room with view of the sea was booked as promised.
The room is a simple room no amenities as you would expect, no phone, no towels , but it was clean and neat with a magnificent view.
Breakfast at the restaurant was simple but sufficient and tasty , unexpectedly , a violonist  playing music for breakfast.
Although i work in hotels for almost 35 years , i was amazed with the service and care we recieved during our stay.
It is worth every penny and if we ever go back to Alexandia , will certainly book this hotel again.
reviews.title: Expect the unexpected

reviews.text:

reviews.text:
I booked 2 nights at New Capri Hotel from June 2nd ..I was hesitated in the beginning to book in this hotel ..because the rate per night was very reasonable ...so I expected that the service will be poor ..but once I entered to the reception, I changed my mind. .the people there are very friendly.
They welcomed me and my mother with a smile ..the house keeping chief  (I don't remember her name) ..she showed me the room and its facilities (The Air Conditioner, the water heater, the refrigerator ) all of them is working perfectly. ..

The view is awesome , the room is overlooking the sea and Saad Zaghlol Square (Raml station ,Downtown )

They are serving open buffet breakfast, It's very delicious,  different kinds of cheese,  omelet , Egyptian beans and jam.
They offered also hot drink. .I had White Tea while my mother ordered Black Tea

I would like to thank all the persons who made our trip memorable ..Ms.Asmaa and Mr. Karim (the receptionists)..and Mr.Mahmoud (The restaurant chief ) ..and all the staff behind the scenes. .

I recommend New Capri ...to all the people who would like to spend great time in Alexandria 

And I hope to come again soon
reviews.title: Great stay and friendly staff

reviews.text:
i like this hotel, although it's not the best but it's very practical if you wanna visit Alexandria for a weekend.
best thing is the hotel sea view and the location

stuff are decent
reviews.title: value for money

reviews.text:
I am 100% certain that my jewellery was stolen here. Stay clear of this hotel for your own sake.

This hotel was my third choice, after the Crillon and the Union couldn't accommodate the three nights of my last minute trip to Alexandria. The lone staff member billed me 160 EGP per night for a single room with a private bathroom. These are high-season prices for a not-high-season time of year, but I was exhausted and didn't know of a forth hotel option to consider on the spot. In terms of cleanliness, the room was okay but I had to ask specifically for toilet paper and soap and for the remote control to the AC, requests that made the receptionist act like I was being irrational. I received toilet paper and the remote for the AC (but no soap), but the TV didn't work. I was however pleasantly surprised that my room number 108 had a nice seaside view. Wifi was free but the signal was weak and it would cut in and out.

I must add that this was during Ramadan and that is relevant because when I checked in (in the evening, after Iftar), the receptionist was quick to bill me for "breakfast included" but I had to haggle with the staff in the morning to get a bite of old cheese, old cucumber slices, bread, a hard boiled egg and one cup of tea. The next morning I got the same food but nothing to drink. On the last morning they called my room to ask if I was having breakfast but I declined because I intended to go down to the famed cafe "Delice" around the corner instead.

The main point of this review however was that my gold necklace was stolen from my room and that it could only have been taken by someone on staff. I was travelling with two pieces of jewellery, a ring and a necklace, and remember distinctly taking off my necklace and leaving it in the room on the first morning. I didn't want to wear it on the second day either, so it was only when I packed my small bag on the last morning that I noticed it was gone. I was quick to turn the room and my few belongings upside down when I couldn't find the necklace where I'd left it. (It's one of those personalised necklaces that spell out your name, that was popular in the 90s, so it's not a small piece that can easily be overlooked.) 

It was check out time and maintenance was at my door but when I told him that I had a problem, the head of maintenance came to my room (the same lady who had brought me breakfast on the first day) and started concocting bizarre excuses for why it couldn't have been them who took the necklace. Instead of listening, she started to quiz me on why I threw a pack of gum in the waste basket next to my bed that she then fished out and held in my face. She was also quick to tell me that I'd lost my necklace outside in the city or that I must have fallen into my bra (?) and that - again - it couldn't have been them. She then aggressively pulled off the sheets and flipped the mattresses to demonstrate - something.

By then my Egyptian (Alexandrian) friend joined me in the search for my missing jewellery and was talking with the receptionist (not the same person who checked me in). It a very small hotel and I never saw or heard other guests while I was there, so the staff knew when I was coming and going and that l left them the key. The receptionist however still asked me who had had access to my room and I said I always left the key to my room with the reception when I was out. When she heard this, she raised her eyebrows and said, "Oh..." 

I don't know if that "oh" meant that any one of the carousel of people that I would see at the reception wasn't trusted, even by colleagues. Or that this "oh" meant that the New Capry Hotel has had other incidents like this happen before. 

My friend and I are now in touch with the manager of the hotel to see what can be done. But I am vivid. One expects to have to be careful when out and about but this was a tiny hotel and I really didn't see this one coming. The staff truly must have thought that I was just some dumb tourist passing through and that I'd just disappear again in a day or two. But I won't. This is still an ongoing story and if my jewellery doesn't surface, then there will be further consequences. I will update this review accordingly.
reviews.title: Beware: Thieves on staff

reviews.text: Its amazing place but they need a privte entrance.the stuff is very polite.the room is very clean . The hotel in the center of the city and this is another reason to come here in the next time...........

reviews.text:
This motel is really a nice place to stay for a day or two with exactly what you payed for.
Clean bedrooms and bathroom with a very nice view toward the amazing Alexandria Coast. Very affordable and friendly crew
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text:
People were nice bla bla bla, fair enough view was stunning bla bla bla, breakfast was enjoyable bla bla bla.

We got a room for three of us, we are students so don't mind roughing it a bit but this was beyond belief.

The room was in the process of being renovated so there was dust everywhere it looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while, the beds were made however wether or not the sheets were clean is questionable, the blankets were definitely not and I found myself sleeping under a blanket that had obviously been used at the beach as it was full of sand.

Next to the main road so the single glazed windows do not help with the noise at all, to top it all off the room absolutely stank of sewage as our toilet wasn't draining properly.....did not sleep a wink that night!

For what we paid, which was equivalent to £8 a night it was the worst place and the most expensive place I stayed out of the 4 hostels we stayed in Egypt.

I would definitely not go again!!
reviews.title: Gorgeous view.....horrendous room!!

reviews.text: After the glowing review in the Rough Guide, we checked in, and then checked right out. Peeling paint, dangerous electrics in the bathroom, stained sheets and rooms with refurbishment work still going on. We asked to see the other rooms, and admittedly the upper floor was a little better. But it was without a doubt the most down-at-heel establishment I have seen since my gap year travels nearly 20 years ago. Avoid.
reviews.title: Third-rate budget hotel

reviews.text: Ok, but nothing exceptional. Old building, the elevator stops one floor under the hotel. Barely decent rooms, but reasonably clean. Very well located, good for one or two nights. Slow wireless internet and average staff friendliness.
reviews.title: Nothing special apart from the location, you get what you pay for.

name: Maamura Palace Hotel
address: 1 Youssef El Sebaey St. El Mamorah Shatia, Alexandria 21599 Egypt

reviews.text: One of the hotels where we come every year. The best thing there is the wonderful view from the balcony, you can see the sea and the trees. The food is delicious but it needs more variety. A really good and calm place for family. You can sit in the terrace and enjoy the nice weather of Alexandria. The hall is comfortable with free and good quality WiFi. The staff is so friendly and helpful, they always ask if you need anything. The price is resonable. The room service is available and is good. I highly recommend this hotel if you need a quiet and lovely place for the family.
reviews.title: Beautiful and amazing place

reviews.text: It's almost the complete package. The hotel is great with comfy rooms,private beach, good and helpful staff. But nothing is complete. There is no pool, the building looks old from the outside and the restaurant has the same breakfast every single day . Better than expected specifically the room. The view is wonderful and I have visited them before so i noticed that they made some renovation of the rooms. Nice place for a family
reviews.title: In general it is good

reviews.text:
Maamura palace hotel is within secured area just near Montazah park area. Room looked at first site quite good and nice but after a while we realized that the sheets where dirty and walls had mold and bulges of moisture. We had also problems with hot water which was available during the day but not after 10pm. there was no WIFi in the room and in the lobby we got help from the stuff to get some kind of WIFI with registering on some Egyptian phone number. 
We did not eat in the hotel except breakfast which was not so reach in variety so probably if we had more nights there it would not be sufficient.
Nice balcony area with a view to the see area is great for relaxing after a day of walking around. Stuff was friendly and on service but all in all it is a low cost hotel and   it needs a proper renovation if they want more guest.
reviews.title: Hotel has seen better days

reviews.text:
موقع مميز له شاطئ خاص يوفر دخول المعموره والشاطئ مجانا 
اسعاره معقوله خاصه بوجود شاطئ مميز مجانا لان الاسكندريه الان اسعار دخول الشواطئ الكويسه اصبح مكلف
الغرف المطله على البحر لسه مجددنها ومميزه وبالطبع اغلى من الغرف الجانبيه التى تطل على حديقه المنتزه
الغرف واسعه والحمام كبير 
الفطار مقبول
الاطفال مجانا فى العرفه لم يتم احتسابهم
معامله موظفى الاستقبال  ليست احترافيه (مش عارف اشرحها ازاى ) يتعاملون معك على انك زبون مصيف جاى تأجر  شقه وليس عميل فندقى
ويبررون تصرفهم مما يشاهدوه ويحدث لهم من نزلا اخرين
طبعا يوجد باركنج مجانا والمسؤل عنه يمسج العربيه يوميا 
اسعار المشروبات مقبوله والخدمه عامه بعيدا عن الريسبشن جيده
اخيرا ...فندق المعموره بالاس كان ينزل به الفنانين والمشاهير وله ذكريات جميله 
الجلوس فى الكافيتريا له نكهه خاصه

قضيت ٥ ليالي في الفندق و كل يوم كانت تحاول الادارة والعاملين في الفندق سرقة قدر من الوجبات المدفوعة مسبقا.. و حاولو استغلال قاعة الاجتماعات المحجوزة طوال الفترة في المساء!
بالاضافة الى عدم التعاون من قبل موظف الاستقبال والتعامل بقليل من الاحترام. لا انصح بالنزول في هذا الفندق مطلقا رغم موقعه المميز

name: Zafero Studios and Apartments - Families Only
address: 688 Tariq Aljaysh Aldawr Alta'Aniy, Alexandria 12345 Egypt

reviews.text:
Lovely aparthotel in the northern part of Alexandria, close to the park and Montazah beach. Huge apartment, comfortable beds, fast internet. A convenient place to stay in this city, but it is important to understand that this is not the historical center of Alexandria, but almost 10 kilometers from it. There is no problem to get to the center, by taxi for 20 minutes, but in this particular area there is nothing special to do in the context of tourist attractions, except for Montazah Park.

This is our third visit to Alexandria and we are staying at this aparthotel. But this time we experienced disappointment when they took extra money from us for cleaning the apartment, although in fact they never cleaned the apartment for 3 days of stay. This was not the case on previous visits and was not specified in our current booking. We did not argue with the owner, 8 dollars is a trifle and it is easier to pay than to argue. But an unpleasant aftertaste remained.
reviews.title: Nice, but unpleasant aftertaste remained

We stayed for just one night whilst we had a quick stopover in Alexandria. The staff were so friendly and welcoming, check in was easy and quick.
Our room was a perfect size and over looked the water,  beautiful view. You can hear the road outside as its in a busy area, but this didn't ruin our stay.
We even got free fruit delivered to our room, a lovely touch.
Its in a good area along the corniche where you can walk up and down and easily find a variety of restaurants in walking distance.
The only downside is the road is incredibly busy as it is the main road along the sea front, it's difficult to cross the road, but this seemed the case everywhere in Alex.
Would recommend and definitely stay here again if I return to Alexandria.

Такие кадры надо холить и поощрять!         Повар и его шедевры притягивают, 😋отдельное ему «БЛАГОДАРИМ»!!! Хочется всегда вернуться и попробовать его вкусняшки!👍😊Девочки с уборкой номеров - отлично, спасибо им за их нелегкий труд! Отдельное спасибо мальчикам Павлу и Курти в СПА! Их волшебные руки творят чудеса! Извините, кого не упомянула, но вы все молодцы!!! Ваш гость Светлана! В этом году жили в 4105!👍

reviews.title: Ожидание нового отдыха в прекрасном отеле Довиль

reviews.text: Если вы хотите оказаться в сказке вам отель Довиль - Анапа. Для вас здесь созданы все условия , чтобы ваш отдых оказался на самом высоком уровне. Анимация , обслуживание , питание будет вас радовать каждый день. Для детей и их родителей созданы все условия , чтобы получить полный релакс и провести весело и беззаботно отдых в отеле Довиль. Персонал отеля ждёт вас.
reviews.title: Сказочный замок.

reviews.text: Отдыхали с семьёй в августе 2016. Отель превзошёл все ожидания, ухоженная территория, приятный персонал, чистые номера, пляж, питание и многое другое. Приехали мы за 2,5 часа раньше чем заселение, нам выдали карту и предложили пройтись по территории отеля и пользоваться услугами. Пройтись нам не хотелось, так как были с дороги, но на обед, который начинается в 12:30 мы пошли. Ресторан просто шикарен, обилие еды, выпивки, сладостей и фруктов. Персонал после каждого посетителя заменял приборы и скатерти, всегда убирал, по мере загрязнения стола. Ждали мы недолго и к нашей радости, отель сделал нам подарок повысив категорию номера с Стандарта до Супериора. И мы отправились отдыхать. Рассказывать можно очень много. Для детей: собственная кафешка с пироженками, мороженным, коктейлями, рядом бассейн и площадка, футбольное поле. Вечером дискотека, развлекательная программа. В течении дня много детских комнат, в зависимости от возраста. Шведский стол также не обделял изобилием пищи, был отдельный детский стол с очень вкусной едой. Постоянно каши и супы. Для взрослых: Ресторан с пиццей и пастой и прохладительными напитками рядом со сценой и бассейном. На втором этаже, ещё один ресторанчик с шашлыком, люлями, картофелем фри и блинчиками, атакже горячительными напитками. Также на втором этаже бильярд, караоке, аэрохоккей(мы с мужем любим играть). На территории имеется спа центр, где различными Банни и сауны, бассейны с гидромассажный и минеральной водой, дождики (тропический, компрессионный). Пляж: идти пешком мин 10 спокойным шагом, если не хотите ходить, то Вам в помощь маленький автобус , возит каждые 15-30 мин. Сам пляж огорожен, на территории пляжа много лежаков и кафе, где можно взять мороженное, перекусить хот догом и запить соками или квасом, хотя можно и чаем. Песок чистый, без окурок, без стёкол и мусора. Само море конечно зеленое, но ведь это Анапа, там в июне месяце море начинает цвести с нашей то анамальной жарой. В общем рассказывать можно бесконечно, главное отдых прошёл на ура!!!!
reviews.title: Отличный семейный отдых

Breakfast only starts at 9am so it’s useless for business travellers, although breakfast box was offered, we preferred not to take it. Room is very basic. Only plus point was cleanliness which is why the rating is poor rather than terrible.

reviews.text: very poor hotel, i visited that hotel on 1st of August 2019, the hotel in very nice area but the hotel  management is not taking about it, the rooms are so dirty, the room toilet is not clean i tried to leave the hotel after 2 hrs after check in because that bad situation but they didn't accept to give me to give the money back, the breakfast trace was so nice and the people were so friendly, that resort can be used only for day use but for resort family can stay on its impossible,the hotel charges are so expensive for such resort, the hotel  wifi was so bad.
reviews.title: POOR HOTEL

reviews.text: Montazah is a perfect place to be in . The Hotel clean .. good👍 private beach women can wear👙 swimsuit .. kids pool is good ..adult pool is good .. there are towels on Beach , pool  & staff are good . Nice restaurant ☕🍳🍞with a good view 🌊🌊.. we spent a nice vaction .. hope repeat it ☺
reviews.title: Good

reviews.text:
the staff are friendly, cleanliness is very good, location is perfect but to clarify some issues: sea view or pool view isn't applicable in anywhere from the hotel except from the top main restaurant only which was under repair at this time (it should be mentioned during the reservation), the beach isn't so close to the hotel, almost 15 min walk to the allowable beach entrance. breakfast was at Roastery restaurant close to the hotel which considered very good.
Note: the location itself at Montaza Palace is amazing, except some unethical behaviors from the visitors which should be monitored well from the Montaza Palace security team, such activities could lead to consider Montaza Palace as an unsafe location in the future.
reviews.title: Good vacation

reviews.text:
Our stay was very nice. Unfortunately it's very difficult to find single rooms, so the guys had to share a double room. We wanted to stay one more night but again, no rooms left. Hence, try to book as early as possible. 
The resort is peaceful and quiet, perfect for relaxation, the garden is lovely and the staff is very nice and friendly. Don't expect too much from the rooms though - they are not exactly worth 4 stars. And there's music on the hallway which is OK, but can be disturbing after a while and especially after 9PM. 
There's also a beautiful private beach where women can wear a two piece bathing suit. I even went sunbathing twice all alone and I didn't catch unwanted attention (unlike outside the resort walls where it's best not to leave any skin uncovered). The water is very clean and crystal clear.
reviews.title: Amazing garden and very nice staff

reviews.text:
The hotel is located inside the Montazah Garden (which itself is a must see for the tourists) and just beside the Mediterranean Sea. Naturally it is very quiet and has a very nice view. Rooms are clean, good and have all sorts of staffs you expect but are small. The staffs are friendly and helpful. View from the rooftop restaurant is very nice.
The lighting in the room and the ventilation system in the toilet could been better. The staffs in the restaurant should be quicker.

Forget the minor limitations, worth a choice.
reviews.title: Nice location and good stay

reviews.text:
Более удобного отеля не встречала! На нас троих я муж и дочка обошлось 1300 $ Есть весь сервис от такси до обмена валют. 
На ресепшене шумно. Большинство туристов из Германии 70%. Они плохой отель не выберут. 😁😌Лучше доплатите немного чтобы быстрее заселится. Тоже советую сделать чтобы получить номер с хорошим видом. 
Территория отеля очень зелёная пальмы и газоны. На газонах проводят занятия йогой. Для детей есть детский клуб.
Бассейн прямо у входа в номера. До пляжа 2 минуты ходьбы из любой точки отеля. Пляж с очень удобным входом в море, без кораллов и гальки, то что надо для детей и пожилых людей. 
Рядом набережная Марина. Недалеко находится пирс откуда отправляются экскурсии на разные острова. В этот раз заказали в Инстаграм тур от компании topegypttour на остров Парадайз. А реально побывали на двух островах, ещё на остров Гифтун съездили. За 20$ это почти даром🤭Вобщем рекомендую! Останетесь довольны!🌺🌹🌸👍👌
reviews.title: Отдыхаем вместе.

reviews.text:
La chambre était propre et spacieuse, le personnel gentil surtout Fedi a la réception (c'est rare d'avoir ses qualités en egypte, très professionnel)
La piscine est grand propre, le problème de la plage est pourrie, on a pas pu se baigner, les personnels de restaurant aussi sont accueillants
reviews.title: Une bonne expérience

reviews.text:
This place was a real bargain. pretty cheep (150L) for a room with bath room.pretty clean, all the facilities - hot water, cieling fan, toilet, refrigirator work perfectly well. kind but not nosy staff, the cleaning lady does a great job (which is somewhat uncommon in egypt). central location, my room even hade a nice view. only minus is no WiFi, but you can go to the cafe below where they are really nice and have Wifi.
as a solo traveller couldnt ask for more.
reviews.title: all you can expect from a buget hotel. defenetly recomended

reviews.text: This is a budget hotel with a wonderful location near the Cornish and in the center of the city. The rooms are basic but more than adequate, especially at the price. The staff is helpful, but quality of English varies.
reviews.title: Honest, Clean, Friendly

reviews.text: I can say it's quite good because its cheap hotel. Me and my friend stayed in twin room. Beds were a little bit uncomfortable. Bathroom was reasonable. There was a TV in this room and there was BBC World, finally we heard some British accent instead of Arab english. I would like to mention location. Its location is very good I think. It's in the middle of the castle and Alexandria library. There are lots of coffee houses which you can find sisha near the hotel and bunch of restaurants. 10 steps away you can find internet cafe.
reviews.title: Quite good

reviews.text:
+ Cheap price
+ Friendly staff
+ Good A/C (was helpful in summertime)
+ As a woman travelling alone I felt myself safe

+- Location - located in downtown near to sea. It is a good thing, but it also has the dark side - the noiseness of the are is quite big.
+/- Breakfast - Simple and enough for me, but always the same. The view of the breakfast place is good, though.

- Dirty bathroom (!) and rooms
- Quite unforcomtable beds

So, if you are looking really cheap accomodation and not going to stay long time, I could recommed this hotel. But if you are ready to pay more a little more for accomodation than 20 $ per night, then choose an another hotel. 

Even if the staff is friendly and really helpful, it doesen't change the fact that bathrooms and rooms were quite dirty. The cleaner just took the rubbish away and made my bed - he didn't do anything to the floors which were dirty. In my badroom there were all the time puddle on the floor and he couldn't clean it away.
reviews.title: If the cheap is what you are really looking for

reviews.text: because it was cheap we really couldn't complaint much. we stayed in a triple, and had our own bathroom. the place was pretty dirty, the beds were hard and the blankets were questionable. the bathroom was very simple, no bathtubs, simple shower, that basically floods the whole bathroom after you finish. however, it had high ceilings and a pretty convenient location. unfortunately you cannot see the ocean.
reviews.title: if cheap is what motivates you

reviews.text:
1st Visit to the hotel and it was for 1 day to visit doctor for my sun.
hotel is clean room is clean but small.air conditioning is good the view of the sea is perfect the food was very good in the 7th floor restaurant.
the staff helpful.
will try to visit after my son getting better for a long holiday ISA.
thanks.
Abdellatif Mostafa
reviews.title: 1st Visit to the hotel and it was for 1 day to visit doctor for my sun

reviews.text: I stayed for 2 days in a quick fun trip with friends. We were all men and took a suite "2 connected rooms". The rooms were clean, well equipped, and with clean bathroom. The concern about the room that it does not have a safe for valuables. Also, the electric socket for the kittle was not reachable. The food was ok. The staff was friendly and helpful. No complain about the stay.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text:
I spent the weekend with my family. We took two suites and a room, the only good thing is the view of the sea. The rooms are rundown, the windows don’t close so all the noise from the street is in your room, the water in the the bathrooms of the two suites was boiling and when they fixed it, there was only cold water!!!
The extra bed they got in one of the suites was damaged and when we tried to talk to the manager he didn’t even apologize and said that this is the case with all extra beds in all hotels all over the world!!
They have no baby beds and no baby chairs!!
Moreover, and this is the worst of all, we called before we booked and asked if they had handicapped rooms and if they could make a desk chair with wheels available in the handicapped room and they confirmed. When we arrived we discovered they had no handicapped rooms and they would not give us an office chair just for the night. 
Extremely unprofessional staff, the only good thing in this hotel is the view, which you can get in many other much better hotels overlooking the sea in Alexandria.
reviews.title: Worst Management

reviews.text: I stayed with my family for a couple of nights. The hotel has a very strong management owned by the Egyptian Navy, if you have a complain the management will respond very quickly. Hotel is super clean with renovated rooms and has a very special location overlooking the sea. Breakfast has a good variety of food. The only two things the hotel need to work on are the elevators they are tiny and slow, also the WiFi inside the room is not very strong. Overall I had two splendid nights. Thank you Officer Amr for taking care of us during our stay.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Nice place if we are talking about value for money with average quality, the most useful thing is free parking, and the thing worst is rooms furniture is old, but its clean and the food quality is average as well.
reviews.title: Nice place as value for money

reviews.text:
The one star is given for the location and the sea view. Management gets zero.

The A/C in the rooms are cooling only, has no heating.
The internet is in the lobby and the lower floor cafeteria, no internet in the rooms.
They loudly broadcast the Friday prayer speech on loud speakers outside the mosque? the speech is for the prayers at the mosque, not for everyone in the lobby? 
We were setting at the lobby and were asked to leave because the commander is visiting? Guys, this is your commander not ours! we don't care !!
Navy should focus on defending the country and leave the hotel business to professionals!
reviews.title: Be aware, they are confused between civilian gustes and navy personnel !

reviews.text:
The guest house is nice, we spend there couple of days for our honeymoon, the rooms are clean, however need small touch, to be more cozy. 
We had a great sea view from the room, was nice to stay on a high bed, watching the sea and enjoying Mediterranean Sea while we were eating tasty freshly baked pizza from room service (very nice pricies). The hotel somehow belong to the army, so everything is cheap, but nice. 
We were happy there, 4 from 5 is due to the small details like untidy staff uniform, old elevators, etc.
reviews.title: Honeymoon

reviews.text: Rooms are clean and well furnished overlooking the Mediterranean sea. Furniture a little bit old but generally we enjoyed our stay. The worst thing was the elevator but they said it will be replaced shortly.
reviews.title: Weekend

reviews.text:
Al Mahrousa hotel is at the moment under construction. It is situated just near the sea and the biggest coastal road in Alexandria which is quite busy during the whole day. Location is good and you can quite easy reach everything you need. Hotel  needs a urgent improvement in many things. Elevators are bad with no door and you can see concrete blocks between the floors while going up or down. There is no WI-FI signal in the room, and the one in the lobby is not usable for foreign citizens as it requires a local mobile phone number. Room was clean and the service quite good. Bathroom shower was in such condition that a part of the water from the shower was splashing outside the shower.
Breakfast was quite rich and diverse with polite service.
reviews.title: Hotel in renovation

reviews.text:
Very poor hotel but with reasonable pricec.
Bad service room and bad breakfast.
Staying there cheap but u ll not enjoy at all sleeping there.
Bed are not comfortable..
I don't recommend at all to stay there. If you are a solo traveller you can stay 1 night.

reviews.text: When sees the name “Sheraton,” one associates it with excellence, and at least minimum standards of quality. Unfortunately, the specific hotel disappointed on almost every level. Internet non-functional. Old building and rooms, run down. Definitely* not 5 star. Staff at initial check-in, not only not helpful, but somewhat combative and rude. Overall an unpleasant experience that I will not repeat.
reviews.title: Does not live up to the Sheraton name, disappointing experience, would not repeat

owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for staying with us recently and for having taken the time to post a review about your stay on Marriott.com. I apologize that we did not meet your expectations and have taken particular note of your suggestion that the hotel needs refurbishment/redecoration.
Please rest assured that we do take your feedback very seriously and that we will do our utmost to better meet your expectations next time given a chance.
In regards to the renovation, we are currently planning extensive renovations starting with a complete renovation project for our building façade, and many other efforts invested to keep our authentic hotel well maintained and our rooms in a good shape.

Many thanks again for your feedback

The Management

reviews.text:
This hotel is in a poor state of repair at present.
It is worn out. They tried to keep the rooms clean but when the floor board are worn out the cleaner cannot do much.
The double room we had was very small as well.
Take care with using room service. Two coffees, we had. The bill can and we signed for it in Egypt pounds ok, so far. The when we paid the bill, when leaving the hotel, the Hotel converted the bill to US dollars, THE HOTEL REFUSED TO EXCEPT EGYPT POUNDS AT THIE POINT. our credit card was on British pounds. So I had to pay two lots of conversions. Made the two coffees very expensive!
The breakfast. Well you could eat them without any problem but not very much choice. The service was very good. Just don’t expect too much.
The reception area, and the reception staff overall, did poor service. Made me feel like I was not wanted there. First hotel in a long time that managed to do that.
This hotel was branded is a Sheraton now seems to be moving over to a Marriott. The differences between the two are apparent. At present very much at the poor end of Marriott standards. Forget about Sheraton standards I don’t exist in this hotel
Overall I would not go to this hotel again. To expensive for want we got.
reviews.title: Present name Sheraton Hotel really and Poor Marriot hotel

reviews.text:
Fortunately we only stayed here one night and as such we put up with the problems.
The hotel’s  location is on tend ring with decent views of the Med. the city traffic doesn’t help at all making it difficult to go anywhere quick and you need to ensure you book your hotel near to where you are proposing to go.
The hotel was very busy but that didn’t seem ti be an issue. It was the room itself which really let the hotel down. As we entered the door it looked tired and need to updating. The curtain was blowing which we assumed was the air con only to realise that there was a gap between the balcony door and the door frame !! Also a number of the plug sockets didn’t work properly. Overall the room was unsatisfactory.
Not the usual Sheraton standard
reviews.title: Not the usual Sheraton standard

owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
This hotel (was) considered to be one of Egypt’s and not only Alexandria’s top notch hotels, but not anymore.
And by here I mean it (was) not it (has been).
It’s no more a hotel to stay at.
At check in I got shocked by seeing the bed sheets old, dirty and having several cuts.
The pillow covers were dirty!!!
And the hotel is among the Marriott Bonvoy Chain!!How is it ranked among this chain?
The breakfast open buffet is catastrophic or let’s say it’s a nightmare or a distaster.
Dirty tables, poor quality breakfast (except the bakeries which can be rated 8/10).
Variety so limited and too ladies only I have to admit that they overcome major obstacles by their positive attitude.
The only positive side is that staff are kind hearted and helpful as much as they can.
The hotel is so old and the rooms are dirty and old furnished.
The TV sets are old and the channels varieties are terrible.
Very sad that such an iconic hotel reached this v poor level.
Unfortunately..not recommended except if it’s the only option in a rainy cold night once in a blue moon.
reviews.title: Poor, chaotic, old fashioned. An experience which should not be repeated by all means.

reviews.text:
Let me start from the beginning of my stay, I booked 7 night’s 2 rooms, me & my family, each room was in different floor!
First impression during the check in was smooth no issue, except the front desk agent was arguing with me regarding the breakfast since I chose to select the welcome gift Breakfast instead of points, but he kept telling me it’s not available, at the end I showed him the Bonvoy APP which says (You can change the welcome gift to breakfast or local amenities upon check in, just inform the front desk) his knowledge about Marriott bonvoy privileges was poor.
Add for this that they refused to upgrade any of my reservation under the pretext renovation project, despite of suite availability online!! Even they didn’t give me sea front rooms, despite am a Titanium member! As priority of upgrade.
The room’s very old, Rusty kettle and fridge, damaged towels & bed linens .Room setup not completed at all, I have to ask for every single item in the room. Such as water, coffee, bathrobe, shaving kit!
I went down to change the rooms but again the front desk was rude, and refused to change the rooms, then I asked for a manager who tried his best. At the end we stayed in 2 different floors. I was very disappointed but I have to agree as I assumed they are honest with me.
The room cleanliness overall was not good at all, you can find dust everywhere, dirty and damage bed sheet & pillows covers and towels. Both rooms not cleaned well most of the time. 
The water flooded in the sink due to Poor water drainage .one of the rooms the toilet flush not working for many days even we reported no body fix it ! 
The best experience happened to me at the restaurant & lounge and the swimming pool.
The restaurant team were super excellent, Mr.Mohammed the restaurant manager he’s a fantastic person, always smiling, helpful, excellent customer services, he is following & focusing in all details, all the girls working very hard, despite the restaurant operation very hard & busy but we found them always keep their smiling and High level of performance, they respond to all your request in a professional manner, I wish I could remember all their names (Heba, Rawan, Mona) 
The food was good, good varieties, all chefs around the buffet were good, especially the Bakery Chef, she always smiling and very helpful.
The swimming pool team were excellent, especially Kawarshi who is working hard to make everyone happy around the pool, even if the weather 40+C but he still maintain his hard work (Opened umbrella, pool towels) 
The club Lounge was excellent as well, Mr.Ihab the club lounge manager very helpful person.
Ms.Mennah, the club lounge services were super excellent, she was doing a fantastic job to serve everyone, always smiling, and excellent approaching to all customers. I believe she will have a great future in her career.
There’s No WI-FI in the hotel or internet, it was horrible, even if the phone seemed as connected but actually no internet, I think the connection there is belonging to the Stone Age!
The only recover that happened from Food and beverage team. When we found a nail inside the food during the happy hours at the club lounge  , we show it to the lounge team , we understand that this’s not their mistake , but it’s not acceptable at all , the food and beverage team contacted us & invited us for complimentary dinner which we appreciated there effort to recover this mistake . 
In the last day during the checkout, I went to reception to activate my key since I have free late check out till 16:00 PM , whenever I go reception I have to wait someone to approaching me , I felt that they avoid welcoming , they didn’t even make any eye contact with guests , they just look at  computer and they feel surprised that costumer standing in front of them waiting their permission to speak to any of them .
The lady at the reception informed me that I don’t have free late check out, despite I showed her that I got a confirmation from Marriott bonvoy application , but she ignored that and she informed me that we are only who give or confirm any late check out , which means forget Marriott bonvoy app we don’t care about it . she was very rude during our conversation and her face turned into angry, her body language and face reaction explained her anger & nervousness when I showed her Marriott bonvoy application .she treated me very bad .At the end I asked for the manager again , who came politely and confirmed the late check out .
Over all , the front deck team who should be number 1 in costumers service I believe they deserve zero costumers service , zero approaching , zero knowledgeable, the security staff or police services in lobby showing better approaching than entire reception team , every time when I pass in or out from lobby I found them greeting me & smiling which reception never did.
They may learn from  restaurant team how hard they working in very busy operation during breakfast & they keep their smiling  and excellent performance , they greeting us whenever we go in or out from the restaurant .
They may learn from swimming pool attendance who working in very hard Circumstance, under hot sun, but he still give all guest good services with smiling & respectable with excellent performance as well, the reception team were working in better conditions but they were providing bad services.
No one thought to give us any courtesy call during my stay in 7 days to check my stay or satisfaction, no one followed up or compensated or recovered the bad services or my complains .no one asked me how was my stay at the checkout time !
I saw the Hotel GM around, I think he have some inspectors or visitors maybe, I was about to speak to him regarding my stay comments, but I didn’t want to embarrassing him in front of the audit, so I decided to write a review, i don’t know he may read it or no, he may care or no but I have to.
I still have many comments, but this’s enough now.
I Wish Marriott hotels having another option in this beautiful city Alexandria but unfortunately no other options.
reviews.title: less than 1 star hotel, Except F&B, lounge, Recreation team. Very Bad Treatment from the Front office.

owner_response.text:
Dear valued guest,

Greetings from Sheraton Montazah Hotel,  

We would like to thank you for taking time to express your concerns regarding your recent stay in our hotel. We have looked at all the points raised and have looked into the matter, through your comments we can improve our day to day operation and detect the areas that need further upgrade and training, as our primary goal is to assure that our guests are always content with the services that they receive at our property. 

Please accept our sincere apologies for the unexpected inconveniences that might have been encountered during your stay and on behalf of Sheraton Montazah Management, let me assure you that we commit ourselves in providing you and all our guests with the highest standard of service in the industry. You have however raised several points which made your stay less than expected, a disappointment to you and us both. 

Hopefully in the future you do allow us the opportunity to redeem ourselves and as such, we will do our best to ensure that you will receive a truly memorable stay at Sheraton Montazah Hotel.

Very sincerely yours,

The Management

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and beautiful. The staff was very friendly and professional. The room was decorated nicely and the bed was comfortable . The rooftop bar played club music, mostly Arabic but some American as well. The location was perfect, within walking distance to the library and the Roman amphitheater, the souks and town center. I stayed in a “Golden Superior Room Direct Sea View with Light Dinner.” The view from the balcony was absolutely spectacular! The light dinner consisted of hors devours, soup, fresh juice, wine and a mini dessert selection. My reservation included a breakfast buffet served in the 6th floor restaurant and was traditional Egyptian food and included a made to order omelet station. They have seating inside as well as in the covered and open air outdoor sections. Again, the view of the Mediterranean Sea with the Citadel in the distance was spectacular! I would definitely book here again.
reviews.title: Very good choice for hotels on the corniche.

reviews.text: The hotel is located right at the bay of Alexandria. Exploring the city by walk (Citadel, Library, downtown area) was easy and the streets around the hotel are bustling in the evening. Paradise Inn has a nice Old World feeling, perfect for a city with such great history. Rooms were clean and comfortable, hotel service attentive and friendly. I enjoyed most the roof-top restaurant and bar, whether during daytime or evening the views across Alexandria bay are phantastic and alone worth a visit. I certainly can recommend this hotel and plan to stay here again next time in town.

reviews.text:
The place looks and feels like a ruin of a place that certainly witnessed better days. The staff are so nice and polite, but the place itself needs a lot of maintenance. I know it is an old palace  but it doesn't have to smell like an old palace! The hallways literally smell old! The air-conditioning is a disaster  either too hot or too cold, the shower was very uncomfortable to use, we had to ask for new sheets because the sheets felt very itchy (clean but haven't been changed for ages). Anything i used from the room (sheets, robes, pillows) smelled like it hasn't been washed or seen the light for ages. The worst part was the food though. I ordered a hot chocolate on our first night to enjoy on the amazing sea view roof, it tasted sooo horrible that i even couldn't drink. The milk even made me feel a bit uncomfortable. The view was so good that i gave the restaurant a second chance, this time to actually eat vegetables that went bad!! And when we complained they told us that the vegetables are just a garnish (not true, they were listed as part of the dish in the menu, and even if true not an excuse!) They tried to fix the situation by offering us complimentary ice cream which tasted as horrible as the hot chocolate. The option of a refund was off-the table though. I don't blame the staff that much because they are very nice, with so little to work with anyway.
I am giving the hotel 3 stars just for thr view and the staff. It is very very overpriced however, you can visit the rooftop while in Alex just to enjoy the view and order something that can't go wrong (a tea maybe).
reviews.title: A wasted great view

reviews.text:
Stayed first on the "executive level 11".   The room was decent, but had a laboring AC to get things cold.  Bed was comfortable, and decent bathroom for all things.    Check in was good and all staff were very good.  Breakfast area was decent buffet selection.  Stay there you get a 4star

2nd stay was another room several floors down, well worn carpet there, noisy from the road below, hard to sleep.  Weak AC, terrible shower setup, with a base and a shower curtain hanging from ceiling.  But it sufficed.   Stay on this level is 3star.

Location is decent in Alexandria, you are surrounded markets on the streets, but you are never far from Corniche or short walk to restaurants and pharmacies shopping.
reviews.title: Two levels to this place overall 3.5 Star

reviews.text:
My wife and I went for Eid break and to say this was a disappointing hotel is an understatement. 

First of all they put us in a smoking room and I have asmtha. I couldn’t breathe. I had headaches and they couldn’t change the room. 

Secondly they STOLE my wife’s clothes after checkout. We realized she left them in cupboard and called to enquire about collecting it and they said they hadn’t seen it. LIES!!!! 2 dresses were left in the cupboard. The cleaner must have stolen them!!

Thirdly, the internet wasn’t working. They said it was an issue with iPhones. I begged for them to let us use their computer as we needed to book another hotel. Only after a few hours they allowed us to do this. 

Fourthly, there was issues with the room. The carpet was old and dirty, not up to 4* standard. The window was broken so it was noisy and the drain in the bath did not work so we showered in dirty water. Gross! 

The night manager was fairly accommodating and one of the receptionists helped us book an Uber. But that was about the only good thing. 

We’re just so disappointed we didn’t even get the clothes back.
reviews.title: WORST HOTEL EVER!!!

reviews.text:
Good morning,

My first visit to Tolip hotel was on 2nd May 2018 for 2 nights.

I book room for 2 adults, when I did my check-in I discoverd that the hotel upgraded my booking from regular room to Two bed room apartment, I was so happppy.

Since that time when ever I visit Alexandria i stay at Toilp Hotel.​ 

I rebooked again a family room in:
 August 2021
 December 2021
 January 2022
 September 2022
December 2022

My booking in September 2022 was a family room for 4 adults when I did check-in the hotel upgraded my family room to the Executive suite with 2 bed rooms.

I booked at 30 December 2022 a family room for 4 adults, I wanted to ask them to upgrade my booking but the receptionist informed me that they have already upgraded my room to the Executive suite with 2 bedrooms.

I was so excited because the hotel treats their regular guest in a special way and special care.

So that I would like to thank you so much for honoring me. I really like your hotel and services. The food is perfect.
 Hopefully, I will get similar services in the future too. I will definitely love to visit again.

I am pleased to say that my stay at Tolip Hotel has been excellent and has surpassed all my expectations.​ The staff was very wonderful​ and catered to my every need. The room was impeccably clean, and all the facilities were in perfect working order.

I would like to thank all the staff for their corporation and effort with me.
starting from the main door security, recipients, room service, house keeping, the staff at the restaurant​ at 11th floor.

Whatever I say, I will not fulfill you and your service.

Thank you for your excellent hospitality, and I hope to stay at Tolip Hotel again soon.

ZAHRA ALBALOOSHI

reviews.text: Wonderful 10/10 experience. The staff is very attentive and considerate. We especially loved the restaurant on the top floor, Iskanderani. There Mr. Adry, Mr. Elsayed, and Mr. Eslam Ibrahim treated us excellently and the fish was among the best we had during our stay in Alexandria. They were clean, organized, hardworking and handled our large group beautifully. The housekeeping was great, very punctual and responded to any requests within minutes. The reception was very welcoming, especially Mr. Alaa, he was a huge help to us. I am already recommending this hotel to all my friends. Especially this location in Alexandria right on the Mediterranean Sea.

reviews.text:
I was here 2 months back and it was fantastic. This time i found the hotel detoriarating significantally and i am not sure if management has changed . Service is the worst. It took me 3 hours to wait for water from housekeeping that never came. Internet was not in the package as before. Breakfast variety and even coffee was disaster. I will never recommend this hotel to stay at even if we have a wedding . It is not worth any penny.
You would rather change current management or at least lift yourselves up.

reviews.title: Alexandria kings ranch

reviews.text:
This is my 1st Visit to King’s ranch, i never thought of visiting it because its little bit far from the heart of alexandria, but i thought of giving a try.
Found out that this hotel deserves to be visited for the peace of mind and relaxing vacation.

The best part of King’s ranch that you can visit for family vacation as it includes some activities for kids, like kids play ground and an indoor pool that stays open till 11 pm.

Of you are in business trip to alexandria, then its also a great hotel for u, 10 mins away from Borj el arab airport. 10 mins from carrefour el Oroba.

Loved the stay in here, the food is fabulous and not very expensive, the staff are very friendly specially the front office Mr. Badr.

Hope the hotel management try to keep it up with the same quality.
reviews.title: Perfectly multi purpose hotel

reviews.text: Beautiful Hotel with Asian Style Design - Outstanding large swimming Pool.  Luxury furniture.  Top security. Excellent buffet with large variety of foods.  It is a brand new construction one year old. It is an exotic atmosphere.
reviews.title: Excellent Buffet and Hotel Design

reviews.text: Good hotel amazing trip I enjoyed so much with my family the animation team is very good they are active and they support us to do anything with them the splash bar is very good and food also is amazing the restraint team is friendly thanks Hilton King's Ranch

reviews.text:
I came in for physiotherapy at the SPA and I was amazed with the great treat and treatment I got.
Very professional physiotherapist and professional hotel staff, from the minute I arrived and I was really pampered 

The room was very spacious and clean, room service was fast and accurate, spa schedule was great and on time

More importantly my back pain was improved and I left very happy
reviews.title: Real treat

reviews.text:
We stayed in the hotel for eight nights. Very much worth it, room is nice clean, reception is very friendly,
Food is fresh and healthy, spa is just amazing clean, feeling relaxed. And of course trip to Egypt is not a trip without do some my favorite Egyptian belly dance, Ali Chif w/animation team is great, and he is so patient with me, he taught me some belly dance, yoga I learnt a lot from him. This is certainly a trip to remember. Certainly will come back if ever get chance again.
Highly recommended place to stay in Alexander Egypt.
